aid-de-camp.definition: An officer selected by a general to carry orders, also to assist or represent him in correspondence and in directing movements

aider.definition: One who, or that which, aids

aigret.definition: The small white European heron. See Egret

aiguillette.definition: A point or tag at the end of a fringe or lace; an aglet

ail.definition: To affect with pain or uneasiness, either physical or mental; to trouble; to be the matter with; -- used to express some uneasiness or affection, whose cause is unknown; as, what ails the man? I know not what ails him

ailantus.definition: A genus of beautiful trees, natives of the East Indies. The tree imperfectly diœcious, and the staminate or male plant is very offensive when blossom

aileron.definition: A half gable, as at the end of a penthouse or of the aisle of a church

ailette.definition: A small square shield, formerly worn on the shoulders of knights, -- being the prototype of the modern epaulet

ailing.definition: sick; unhealthy.  Opposite of well or healthy

ailment.definition: Indisposition; morbid affection of the body; -- not applied ordinarily to acute diseases

ailuroidea.definition: A group of the Carnivora, which includes the cats, civets, and hyenas

ailuropodidae.definition: in some classifications considered the family comprising the giant pandas

ailurus.definition: a genus comprising the lesser pandas

aim.definition: To point or direct a missile weapon, or a weapon which propels as missile, towards an object or spot with the intent of hitting it; as, to aim at a fox, or at a target

aimer.definition: One who aims, directs, or points

aimless.definition: Without aim or purpose; as, an aimless life

ain.definition: belonging to or on behalf of a specified person especially one's self; preceded by a possessive

ain't.definition: A contraction for are not and am not; also used for is not. [Colloq. or illiterate speech]. See An't

ainu.definition: One of a peculiar race found primarily in Hokkaido, in the northern part of the empire of Japan, the Kurile Islands, and nearby.  They are believed to be the native inhabitants of the Japanese islands. The Ainus are stout and short, with hairy bodies.  Also called Aino and hairy Ainu

aioli.definition: a French garlic-flavored mayonnaise.  It is often served with fish and other seafood, and sometimes with vegetables

air.definition: The fluid which we breathe, and which surrounds the earth; the atmosphere. It is invisible, inodorous, insipid, transparent, compressible, elastic, and ponderable

air bladder.definition: An air sac, sometimes double or variously lobed, in the visceral cavity of many fishes. It originates in the same way as the lungs of air-breathing vertebrates, and in the adult may retain a tubular connection with the pharynx or esophagus

air brake.definition: A railway brake powered by compressed air

air cell.definition: A cavity in the cellular tissue of plants, containing air only

air chamber.definition: A chamber or cavity filled with air, in an animal or plant

air cock.definition: A faucet to allow escape of air

air cooling.definition: In devices generating heat, such as gasoline-engine motor vehicles, the cooling of the device by increasing its radiating surface by means of ribs or radiators, and placing it so that it is exposed to a current of air. Cf. Water cooling

air drill.definition: A drill driven by the elastic pressure of condensed air; a pneumatic drill

air engine.definition: An engine driven by heated or by compressed air

air gap.definition: An air-filled gap in a magnetic or electric circuit; specif., in a dynamo or motor, the space between the field-magnet poles and the armature; clearance

air hammer.definition: a hammer powered by compressed air so as to be able to provide powerful repeated strokes; a pneumatic hammer

air hole.definition: A hole to admit or discharge air; specifically, a spot in the ice not frozen over

air jacket.definition: A jacket having air-tight cells, or cavities which can be filled with air, to render persons buoyant in swimming

air line.definition: A path through the air made easy for aërial navigation by steady winds

air pipe.definition: A pipe for the passage of air; esp. a ventilating pipe

air plant.definition: A plant deriving its sustenance from the air alone; an aërophyte

air pocket.definition: A local region in the atmosphere having a downward movement and offering less than normal support for the sustaining surfaces of a flying machine, causing an airplane to drop suddenly.  Same as air hole

air poise.definition: An instrument to measure the weight of air

air pump.definition: A kind of pump for exhausting air from a vessel or closed space; also, a pump to condense air or force it into a closed space

air sac.definition: One of the spaces in different parts of the bodies of birds, which are filled with air and connected with the air passages of the lungs; an air cell

air shaft.definition: A passage, usually vertical, for admitting fresh air into a mine or a tunnel

air sickness.definition: A vomiting or nauseous feeling similar to seasickness experienced by passengers in aircraft; -- it is caused by motion and distinguished from the effects of low air pressure, as it may also occur in the pressurized cabins of large aircraft

air stove.definition: A stove for heating a current of air which is directed against its surface by means of pipes, and then distributed through a building

air vessel.definition: A vessel, cell, duct, or tube containing or conducting air; as the air vessels of insects, birds, plants, etc.; the air vessel of a pump, engine, etc. For the latter, see Air chamber. The air vessels of insects are called tracheæ, of plants spiral vessels

air-built.definition: Erected in the air; having no solid foundation; chimerical; as, an air-built castle

air-slacked.definition: Slacked, or pulverized, by exposure to the air; as, air-slacked lime

air-tight.definition: So tight as to be impermeable to air or other gases; as, an air-tight cylinder; -- said of containers

airball.definition: A throw at the basket that completely misses, not even hitting the rim.  Compare swoosh and nothing but net

airbed.definition: A sack or mattress inflated with air, and used as a bed

airborne.definition: conveyed by or through air, as dust or pollen; as, a clean room is needed to avoid airborne contaminants

airbrake.definition: a small parachute or articulated flap to reduce the speed of an aircraft

airbrush.definition: A kind of atomizer for applying liquid coloring matter, such as paint, in a spray by compressed air

aircraft.definition: Any vehicle, such as an airplane, helicopter, balloon, etc., for floating in, or flying through, the air

aircraftman.definition: a noncommissioned officer in the British Royal Air Force

airdock.definition: a large building at an airport where aircraft can be stored and maintained

airdrome.definition: an airfield equipped with control tower and hangers as well as accommodations for passengers and cargo

airedale.definition: a breed of large wiry-coated terriers, bred in Yorkshire

airer.definition: One who exposes to the air

airfield.definition: a place where planes take off and land; an airport; -- usually used of airports other than those with regularly sheduled commercial flights, such as those at military bases or small fields for private aircraft

airfoil.definition: a surface such as the wing of an airplane designed to provide reactive force when in motion relative to the surrounding air

airframe.definition: the framework and covering of an airplane or rocket (excluding the engines)

airgun.definition: A kind of gun in which the elastic force of condensed air is used to discharge the ball.  The air is powerfully compressed into a reservoir attached to the gun, by a condensing pump, and is controlled by a valve actuated by the trigger.  The common BB gun is a type of air gun

airheaded.definition: lacking seriousness; given to frivolity; scatterbrained; stupid; simple-minded; as, airheaded teenagers.  Contrasted with serious, solemn

airily.definition: In an airy manner; lightly; gaily; jauntily; flippantly

airiness.definition: The state or quality of being airy; openness or exposure to the air; as, the airiness of a country seat

airing.definition: A walk or a ride in the open air; a short excursion for health's sake

airless.definition: Not open to a free current of air; wanting fresh air, or communication with the open air

airline.definition: an organization, usually commercial or governmental, providing transportation by airplane for freight or passengers.  The term includes the organization, its personnel, equipment and other properties, such as approved air routes

airman.definition: A man who ascends or flies in an aircraft; an aviator; an airplane pilot

airmanship.definition: Art, skill, or ability in the practice of aerial navigation; aircraft piloting

airol.definition: A grayish green antiseptic powder, consisting of a basic iodide and gallate of bismuth, sometimes used in place of iodoform

airometer.definition: A hollow cylinder to contain air. It is closed above and open below, and has its open end plunged into water

airplane.definition: a heavier-than-air aircraft.  Same as aeroplane{2}

airplane propeller.definition: a propeller designed for propelling airplanes

airsick.definition: Affected with air sickness or aërial sickness; feeling nauseous due to riding in an airplane

airspace.definition: the atmosphere above a nation and deemed to be under its jurisdiction

airstrip.definition: an airfield without normal airport facilities

airwaves.definition: the medium of transmission of signals by radio or television stations; by radio transmission; -- used non-technically; as, over the airwaves, i. e. by radio or television

airway.definition: a duct that provides ventilation, as in mines

airwoman.definition: A woman who ascends or flies in an aircraft; a woman aviator; a woman airplane pilot or balloonist; an aviatrix

airworthy.definition: fit to fly; -- said of aircraft.  Opposite of unairworthy

airy.definition: Consisting of air; as, an airy substance; the airy parts of bodies

aisle.definition: A lateral division of a building, separated from the middle part, called the nave, by a row of columns or piers, which support the roof or an upper wall containing windows, called the clearstory wall

aisled.definition: Furnished with an aisle or aisles

ait.definition: An islet, or little isle, in a river or lake; an eyot

aitchbone.definition: The bone of the rump; also, the cut of beef surrounding this bone

aizoaceae.definition: a natural family of succulent herbs or small shrubs mostly of South Africa but also New Zealand and North America: carpetweeds; fig marigolds

ajar.definition: Slightly turned or opened; as, the door was standing ajar

ajouan.definition: The fruit of Ammi Copticum, syn. Carum Ajowan, used both as a medicine and as a condiment. An oil containing thymol is extracted from it. Called also Javanee seed, Javanese seed, and ajava

ajour.definition: of or pertaining to objects which are pierced or decorated with an openwork pattern

ajutage.definition: A tube through which water is discharged; an efflux tube; as, the ajutage of a fountain

akee.definition: a tree (Blighia sapida) widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions for its fragrant flowers and colorful fruits; introduced in Jamaica by Captain Bligh of the HMS Bounty

akeridae.definition: a family comprising the bubble shells

akimbo.definition: With a crook or bend; with the hand on the hip and elbow turned outward

akin.definition: Of the same kin; related by blood; -- used of persons; as, the two families are near akin

akinesia.definition: Loss of the ability for voluntary muscle movement

akvavit.definition: Scandinavian liquor usually flavored with caroway seeds

al segno.definition: A direction for the performer to return and recommence from the sign &unr_

al-.definition: All; wholly; completely; as, almighty, almost

alabama period.definition: A period in the American eocene, the lowest in the tertiary age except the lignitic

alabaman.definition: A native or resident of Alabama

alabamian.definition: A native or resident of Alabama

alabaster.definition: A compact variety or sulphate of lime, or gypsum, of fine texture, and usually white and translucent, but sometimes yellow, red, or gray.  It is carved into vases, mantel ornaments, etc

alabastrine.definition: Of, pertaining to, or like, alabaster; as alabastrine limbs

alacrify.definition: To rouse to action; to inspirit

alacrity.definition: A cheerful readiness, willingness, or promptitude; joyous activity; briskness; sprightliness; as, the soldiers advanced with alacrity to meet the enemy

aladinist.definition: One of a sect of freethinkers among the Muslims

alalia.definition: Impairment of articulate speech, or inability to speak, usually due to impairment of control of muscles in the articulatory apparatus

alamire.definition: The lowest note but one in Guido Aretino's scale of music

alamodality.definition: The quality of being à la mode; conformity to the mode or fashion; fashionableness

alamode.definition: According to the fashion or prevailing mode

aland.definition: On land; to the land; ashore

alanine.definition: one of the natural amino acids found combined in the proteins of most living tissues.  It can be isolated as a white crystalline base, C3H7NO2.  The natural form is the L-configuration

alarm.definition: A summons to arms, as on the approach of an enemy

alarmed.definition: Aroused to vigilance; excited by fear of approaching danger; agitated; disturbed; as, an alarmed neighborhood; an alarmed modesty

alarming.definition: Exciting, or calculated to excite, alarm; causing apprehension of danger; as, an alarming crisis or report. -- A*larm"ing*ly, adv

alarmism.definition: the act of giving, or tendency to give, needless warnings

alarmist.definition: One prone to sound or excite alarms, especially, needless alarms

alary.definition: Of or pertaining to wings; also, wing-shaped

alas.definition: An exclamation expressive of sorrow, pity, or apprehension of evil; -- in old writers, sometimes followed by day or white; alas the day, like alack a day, or alas the white

alatern.definition: An ornamental evergreen shrub (Rhamnus alaternus) belonging to the buckthorns

alb.definition: A vestment of white linen, reaching to the feet, an enveloping the person; -- in the Roman Catholic church, worn by those in holy orders when officiating at mass. It was formerly worn, at least by clerics, in daily life

alb sunday.definition: The first Sunday after Easter Sunday, properly Albless Sunday, because in the early church those who had been baptized on Easter eve laid aside on the following Saturday their white albs which had been put on after baptism

albacore.definition: A name applied to several large fishes of the Mackerel family (Scombridae), esp. Thunnus alalunga (formerly Orcynus alalonga); it is a type of tuna or tunny.  The name has been also applied to a larger related species, Thunnus thynnus (formerly Orcynus thynnus), common in the Mediterranean and Atlantic, which is called in New England the horse mackerel

alban.definition: A white crystalline resinous substance extracted from gutta-percha by the action of alcohol or ether

albanian.definition: Of or pertaining to Albania, a province of Turkey

albata.definition: A white metallic alloy; which is made into spoons, forks, teapots, etc.   British plate or German silver. See German silver, under German

albatross.definition: A web-footed bird, of the genus Diomedea, of which there are several species. They are the largest of sea birds, capable of long-continued flight, and are often seen at great distances from the land. They are found chiefly in the southern hemisphere

albert ware.definition: A soft ornamental terra-cotta pottery, sold in the biscuit state for decorating

albertite.definition: A bituminous mineral resembling asphaltum, found in the county of Albert, New Brunswick

albertype.definition: A picture printed from a kind of gelatine plate produced by means of a photographic negative

albescence.definition: The act of becoming white; whitishness

albescent.definition: Becoming white or whitish; moderately white

albication.definition: The process of becoming white, or developing white patches, or streaks

albification.definition: The act or process of making white

albigenses.definition: A sect of reformers opposed to the church of Rome in the 12th centuries

albigensian.definition: Of or pertaining to the Albigenses

albinism.definition: The state or condition of being an albino: abinoism; leucopathy

albino.definition: A person, whether negro, Indian, or white, in whom by some defect of organization the substance which gives color to the skin, hair, and eyes is deficient or in a morbid state. An albino has a skin of a milky hue, with hair of the same color, and eyes with deep red pupil and pink or blue iris. The term is also used of the lower animals, as white mice, elephants, etc.; and of plants in a whitish condition from the absence of chlorophyll

albinoism.definition: The state or condition of being an albino; albinism

albion.definition: An ancient name of England, still retained in poetry

albite.definition: A mineral of the feldspar family, triclinic in crystallization, and in composition a silicate of alumina and soda. It is a common constituent of granite and of various igneous rocks. See Feldspar

albizzia.definition: any of numerous trees or shrubs of the genus Albizia, of the legume family

albolith.definition: A kind of plastic cement, or artificial stone, consisting chiefly of magnesia and silica; -- called also albolite

alborak.definition: The imaginary milk-white animal on which Mohammed was said to have been carried up to heaven; a white mule

albuca.definition: any of various plants of the genus Albuca having large clusters of pale yellow flowers; native to South Africa

albuginaceae.definition: a family of fungi that produce white blisterlike sori on certain flowering plants

albugineous.definition: Of the nature of, or resembling, the white of the eye, or of an egg; albuminous; -- a term applied to textures, humors, etc., which are perfectly white

albula.definition: A genus of fish, the type and sole genus of the family Albulidae

albulidae.definition: A natural family of fish comprising the bonefish

album.definition: A white tablet on which anything was inscribed, as a list of names, etc

album graecum.definition: Dung of dogs or hyenas, which becomes white by exposure to air. It is used in dressing leather, and was formerly used in medicine

albumenize.definition: To cover or saturate with albumen; to coat or treat with an albuminous solution; as, to albumenize paper

albumin.definition: A thick, viscous nitrogenous substance, which is the chief and characteristic constituent of white of eggs and of the serum of blood, and is found in other animal substances, both fluid and solid, also in many plants. It is soluble in water and is coagulated by heat and by certain chemical reagents

albuminate.definition: A substance produced by the action of an alkali upon albumin, and resembling casein in its properties; also, a compound formed by the union of albumin with another substance

albuminemia.definition: The level of albumin in the blood

albuminimeter.definition: An instrument for ascertaining the quantity of albumen in a liquid

albuminin.definition: The substance of the cells which inclose the white of birds' eggs

albuminoidal.definition: Of the nature of an albuminoid

albuminose.definition: A diffusible substance formed from albumin by the action of natural or artificial gastric juice. See Peptone

albuminosis.definition: A condition of excessively high blood albumin level

albuminuria.definition: A morbid condition in which albumin is present in the urine

albumose.definition: A compound or class of compounds formed from albumin by dilute acids or by an acid solution of pepsin. Used also in combination, as antialbumose, hemialbumose

alburn.definition: The bleak, a small European fish having scales of a peculiarly silvery color which are used in making artificial pearls

alburnous.definition: Of or pertaining to alburnum; of the alburnum; as, alburnous substances

alburnum.definition: The white and softer part of wood, between the inner bark and the hard wood or duramen; sapwood

albyn.definition: Scotland; esp. the Highlands of Scotland

alcaic.definition: Pertaining to Alcæus, a lyric poet of Mitylene, about 6000 b. c

alcaid.definition: A commander of a castle or fortress among the Spaniards, Portuguese, and Moors

alcalde.definition: A magistrate or judge in Spain and in Spanish America, etc

alcaldia.definition: The jurisdiction or office of an alcalde; also, the building or chamber in which he conducts the business of his office

alcanna.definition: An oriental shrub (Lawsonia inermis) from which henna is obtained

alcarraza.definition: A vessel of porous earthenware, used for cooling liquids by evaporation from the exterior surface

alcazar.definition: A fortress; also, a royal palace

alcedo.definition: A genus of perching birds, including the European kingfisher (Alcedo ispida). See Halcyon

alces.definition: a genus of elk or moose

alchemize.definition: To change by alchemy; to transmute

alchemy.definition: An imaginary art which aimed to transmute the baser metals into gold, to find the panacea, or universal remedy for diseases, etc. It led the way to modern chemistry

alco.definition: A small South American dog, domesticated by the aborigines

alcoholate.definition: A crystallizable compound of a salt with alcohol, in which the latter plays a part analogous to that of water of crystallization

alcoholature.definition: An alcoholic tincture prepared with fresh plants

alcoholic.definition: Of or pertaining to alcohol, or partaking of its qualities; derived from, or caused by, alcohol; containing alcohol; as, alcoholic mixtures; alcoholic gastritis; alcoholic odor

alcoholism.definition: Chronic excessive drinking of alcoholic beverages that leads to social, occupational, psychological and physiological problems

alcoholization.definition: The act of reducing a substance to a fine or impalpable powder

alcoholize.definition: To reduce to a fine powder

alcoholometer.definition: An instrument for determining the strength of spirits, with a scale graduated so as to indicate the percentage of pure alcohol, either by weight or volume. It is usually a form of hydrometer with a special scale

alcoholometric.definition: Relating to the alcoholometer or alcoholometry

alcoholometry.definition: The process or method of ascertaining the proportion of pure alcohol which spirituous liquors contain

alcoran.definition: The Muslim Scriptures; the Koran (now the usual form)

alcoranic.definition: Of or pertaining to the Koran

alcoranist.definition: One who adheres to the letter of the Koran, rejecting all traditions

alcove.definition: A recessed portion of a room, or a small room opening into a larger one; especially, a recess to contain a bed; a lateral recess in a library

alcyonacea.definition: A group of soft-bodied Alcyonaria, of which Alcyonium is the type. See Illust. under Alcyonaria

alcyonaria.definition: One of the orders of Anthozoa. It includes the Alcyonacea, Pennatulacea, and Gorgonacea

alcyonic.definition: Of or pertaining to the Alcyonaria

alcyonium.definition: A genus of fleshy Alcyonaria, its polyps somewhat resembling flowers with eight fringed rays. The term was also formerly used for certain species of sponges

alcyonoid.definition: Like or pertaining to the Alcyonaria

aldebaran.definition: A red star of the first magnitude, situated in the eye of Taurus; the Bull's Eye.  It is the bright star in the group called the Hyades

aldehyde.definition: A colorless, mobile, and very volatile liquid obtained from alcohol by certain processes of oxidation

aldehydic.definition: Of or pertaining to aldehyde; as, aldehydic acid

alder.definition: A tree, usually growing in moist land, and belonging to the genus Alnus. The wood is used by turners, etc.; the bark by dyers and tanners.  In the U. S. the species of alder are usually shrubs or small trees

alderfly.definition: Any of numerous dark-colored neuropterous insects of the genus Sialis or allied genera. They have predaceous aquatic larvæ, which are used for bait

alderman.definition: A senior or superior; a person of rank or dignity

aldermanic.definition: Relating to, becoming to, or like, an alderman; characteristic of an alderman

aldermanity.definition: Aldermen collectively; the body of aldermen

aldermanlike.definition: Like or suited to an alderman

aldermanly.definition: Pertaining to, or like, an alderman

aldermanry.definition: The district or ward of an alderman

aldermanship.definition: The condition, position, or office of an alderman

alderney.definition: One of a breed of cattle raised in Alderney, one of the Channel Islands. Alderneys are of a dun or tawny color and are often called Jersey cattle. See Jersey, 3

aldine.definition: An epithet applied to editions (chiefly of the classics) which proceeded from the press of Aldus Manitius, and his family, of Venice, for the most part in the 16th century and known by the sign of the anchor and the dolphin. The term has also been applied to certain elegant editions of English works

aldol.definition: A colorless liquid, C4H8O2, obtained by condensation of two molecules of acetaldehyde: CH3CHO + CH3CHO = H3CH(OH)CH2CO; also, any of various derivatives of this. The same reaction has been applied, under the name of aldol condensation, to the production of many compounds

ale.definition: An intoxicating liquor made from an infusion of malt by fermentation and the addition of a bitter, usually hops

ale silver.definition: A duty payable to the lord mayor of London by the sellers of ale within the city

aleatory.definition: Depending on some uncertain contingency; as, an aleatory contract

alebench.definition: A bench in or before an alehouse

aleberry.definition: A beverage, formerly made by boiling ale with spice, sugar, and sops of bread

alecithal.definition: Applied to those ova which segment uniformly, and which have little or no food yelk embedded in their protoplasm

aleconner.definition: Orig., an officer appointed to look to the goodness of ale and beer; also, one of the officers chosen by the liverymen of London to inspect the measures used in public houses. But the office is a sinecure. [Also called aletaster.]

alecost.definition: The plant costmary, which was formerly much used for flavoring ale

alectorides.definition: A group of birds including the common fowl and the pheasants

alectryomancy.definition: Divination by means of a cock and grains of corn placed on the letters of the alphabet, the letters being put together in the order in which the grains were eaten

alee.definition: On or toward the lee, or the side away from the wind; the opposite of aweather. The helm of a ship is alee when pressed close to the lee side

alegar.definition: Sour ale; vinegar made of ale

alegge.definition: To allay or alleviate; to lighten

alehouse.definition: A house where ale is retailed; hence, a tippling house

alem.definition: The imperial standard of the Turkish Empire

alemannic.definition: Belonging to the Alemanni, a confederacy of warlike German tribes

alembic.definition: An apparatus formerly used in distillation, usually made of glass or metal. It has mostly given place to the retort and worm still

alembroth.definition: The salt of wisdom of the alchemists, a double salt composed of the chlorides of ammonium and mercury. It was formerly used as a stimulant

alepole.definition: A pole set up as the sign of an alehouse

aleppo grass.definition: One of the cultivated forms of Andropogon Halepensis (syn. Sorghum Halepense). See Andropogon, below

alerting.definition: a state of readiness to respond

alertness.definition: The quality of being alert or on the alert; briskness; nimbleness; activity

alestake.definition: A stake or pole projecting from, or set up before, an alehouse, as a sign; an alepole. At the end was commonly suspended a garland, a bunch of leaves, or a “bush.”

alethiology.definition: The science which treats of the nature of truth and evidence

alethoscope.definition: An instrument for viewing pictures by means of a lens, so as to present them in their natural proportions and relations

aleurometer.definition: An instrument for determining the expansive properties, or quality, of gluten in flour

aleuronat.definition: Flour made of aleurone, used as a substitute for ordinary flour in preparing bread for diabetic persons

aleurone.definition: An albuminoid substance which occurs in minute grains (“protein granules”) in maturing seeds and tubers; -- supposed to be a modification of protoplasm

aleut.definition: a member of the people inhabiting the Aleutian Islands.  Same as Aleutian, n

aleutian.definition: Of or pertaining to a chain of islands between Alaska and Kamtchatka; also, designating these islands

aleutians.definition: an archipelago in the North Pacific extending southwest from Alaska

alewife.definition: A woman who keeps an alehouse

alexander.definition: a European herb (Smyrnium olusatrum) somewhat resembling celery widely naturalized in Britain coastal regions and often cultivated as a potherb

alexandria.definition: a city on the Mediterranean Sea, the chief port of Egypt

alexandrian.definition: Of or pertaining to Alexandria in Egypt; as, the Alexandrian library

alexia.definition: Inability to read aloud, due to brain disease; the meanings of the words is nevertheless understood.  Called also motor alexia

alexipharmical.definition: Of or relating to an alexipharmic or alexipharmac; warding off poison; antidotal; prophylactic

alexipyretic.definition: Serving to drive off fever; antipyretic; antifebrile

alexiterical.definition: Resisting poison; obviating the effects of venom; alexipharmic

alfa.definition: A plant (Macrochloa tenacissima) of North Africa; also, its fiber, used in paper making

alfalfa.definition: The lucern (Medicago sativa), a leguminous plant having bluish purple cloverlike flowers, and cultivated for fodder; -- so called in California, Texas, etc

alfenide.definition: An alloy of nickel and silver electroplated with silver

alfet.definition: A caldron of boiling water into which an accused person plunged his forearm as a test of innocence or guilt

alfilaria.definition: The pin grass (Erodium cicutarium), a weed in California

alfione.definition: An edible marine fish of California (Rhacochilus toxotes)

alga.definition: A kind of seaweed; pl. the class of cellular cryptogamic plants which includes the black, red, and green seaweeds, as kelp, dulse, sea lettuce, also marine and fresh water confervæ, etc.  The algae are primitive chlorophyll-containing mainly aquatic eukaryotic organisms lacking true stems and roots and leaves

algaroba.definition: The Carob, a leguminous tree of the Mediterranean region; also, its edible beans or pods, called St. John's bread

algaroth.definition: A term used for the Powder of Algaroth, a white powder which is a compound of trichloride and trioxide of antimony.  It was formerly used in medicine as an emetic, purgative, and diaphoretic

algarovilla.definition: The agglutinated seeds and husks of the legumes of a South American tree (Inga Marthae).  It is valuable for tanning leather, and as a dye

algebra.definition: That branch of mathematics which treats of the relations and properties of quantity by means of letters and other symbols. It is applicable to those relations that are true of every kind of magnitude

algebraic.definition: Of or pertaining to algebra; using algebra; according to the laws of algebra; containing an operation of algebra, or deduced from such operation; as, algebraic characters; algebraical writings; algebraic geometry

algebraize.definition: To perform by algebra; to reduce to algebraic form

algerine.definition: Of or pertaining to Algiers or Algeria

algiers.definition: The capital city of Algeria.  Population (2000) = unk

algin.definition: A nitrogenous substance resembling gelatin, obtained from certain algæ

algoid.definition: Of the nature of, or resembling, an alga

algol.definition: A fixed star, in Medusa's head, in the constellation Perseus, remarkable for its periodic variation in brightness

algological.definition: Of or pertaining to algology; as, algological specimens

algologist.definition: One learned about algæ; a student of algology

algology.definition: The study or science of algæ or seaweeds

algometer.definition: An instrument for measuring sensations of pain due to pressure. It has a piston rod with a blunted tip which is pressed against the skin

algonquian.definition: Pertaining to or designating the most extensive of the linguistic families of North American Indians, their territory formerly including practically all of Canada east of the 115th meridian and south of Hudson's Bay and the part of the United States east of the Mississippi and north of Tennessee and Virginia, with the exception of the territory occupied by the northern Iroquoian tribes. There are nearly 100,000 Indians of the Algonquian tribes, of which the strongest are the Ojibwas (Chippewas), Ottawas, Crees, Algonquins, Micmacs, and Blackfeet

algonquin.definition: One of a widely spread family of Indians, including many distinct tribes, which formerly occupied most of the northern and eastern part of North America. The name was originally applied to a group of Indian tribes north of the River St. Lawrence

algorism.definition: The art of calculating by nine figures and zero; computation with Arabic figures

algorithmic.definition: of or pertaining to an algorithm

algous.definition: Of or pertaining to the algæ, or seaweeds; abounding with, or like, seaweed

alguazil.definition: An inferior officer of justice in Spain; a warrant officer; a constable

alhambra.definition: The palace of the Moorish kings at Granada

alhambraic.definition: Made or decorated after the fanciful style of the ornamentation in the Alhambra, which affords an unusually fine exhibition of Saracenic or Arabesque architecture

alias.definition: Otherwise; otherwise called; -- a term used in legal proceedings to connect the different names of any one who has gone by two or more, and whose true name is for any cause doubtful; as, Smith, alias Simpson

alibi.definition: The plea or mode of defense under which a person on trial for a crime proves or attempts to prove that he was in another place when the alleged act was committed; as, to set up an alibi; to prove an alibi

alicant.definition: A kind of wine, formerly much esteemed; -- said to have been made near Alicant, in Spain

alicyclic.definition: pertaining to compounds that have a ring in the structure, but are not aromatic, as cyclohexane or cyclohexene. Compare aliphatic and aromatic

alidade.definition: The portion of a graduated instrument, as a quadrant or astrolabe, carrying the sights or telescope, and showing the degrees cut off on the arc of the instrument

alien.definition: Not belonging to the same country, land, or government, or to the citizens or subjects thereof; foreign; as, alien subjects, enemies, property, shores

alienable.definition: Capable of being alienated, sold, or transferred to another; as, land is alienable according to the laws of the state

alienage.definition: The state or legal condition of being an alien

alienate.definition: Estranged; withdrawn in affection; foreign; -- with from

alienation.definition: The act of alienating, or the state of being alienated

aliene.definition: To alien or alienate; to transfer, as title or property; as, to aliene an estate

alienee.definition: One to whom the title of property is transferred; -- opposed to alienor

alienism.definition: The status or legal condition of an alien; alienage

alienist.definition: One who treats diseases of the mind

alienor.definition: One who alienates or transfers property to another

aliethmoid.definition: Pertaining to expansions of the ethmoid bone or cartilage

alight.definition: To spring down, get down, or descend, as from on horseback or from a carriage; to dismount

align.definition: To adjust or form to a line; to range or form in line; to bring into line; to aline

aligned.definition: in or brought into line with or into proper relative position; -- of spatial position

alignment.definition: The act of adjusting to a line; arrangement in a line or lines; the state of being so adjusted; a formation in a straight line; also, the line of adjustment; esp., an imaginary line to regulate the formation of troops or of a squadron

alike.definition: Having resemblance or similitude; similar; without difference

aliment.definition: That which nourishes; food; nutriment; anything which feeds or adds to a substance in natural growth. Hence: The necessaries of life generally: sustenance; means of support

alimental.definition: Supplying food; having the quality of nourishing; furnishing the materials for natural growth; as, alimental sap

alimentally.definition: So as to serve for nourishment or food; nourishing quality

alimentariness.definition: The quality of being alimentary; nourishing quality

alimentary.definition: Pertaining to aliment or food, or to the function of nutrition; nutritious; alimental; as, alimentary substances

alimentation.definition: The act or process of affording nutriment; the function of the alimentary canal

alimentiveness.definition: The instinct or faculty of appetite for food

alinasal.definition: Pertaining to expansions of the nasal bone or cartilage

aline.definition: To range or place in a line; to bring into line; to align

aliner.definition: One who adjusts things to a line or lines or brings them into line

alioth.definition: A star in the tail of the Great Bear, the one next the bowl in the Dipper

aliphatic.definition: Of, pertaining to, or derived from, fat; fatty; -- applied to compounds having an open-chain structure. The aliphatic compounds thus include not only the fatty acids and other derivatives of the paraffin hydrocarbons, but also unsaturated compounds, as the ethylene and acetylene series.  Compare alicyclic and aromatic

aliquant.definition: An aliquant part of a number or quantity is one which does not divide it without leaving a remainder; thus, 5 is an aliquant part of 16. Opposed to aliquot

aliquot.definition: An aliquot part of a number or quantity is one which will divide it without a remainder; thus, 5 is an aliquot part of 15. Opposed to aliquant

aliseptal.definition: Relating to expansions of the nasal septum

alish.definition: Like ale; as, an alish taste

alisphenoid.definition: Pertaining to or forming the wing of the sphenoid; relating to a bone in the base of the skull, which in the adult is often consolidated with the sphenoid; as, alisphenoid bone; alisphenoid canal

alitrunk.definition: The segment of the body of an insect to which the wings are attached; the thorax

aliturgical.definition: Applied to those days when the holy sacrifice is not offered

aliunde.definition: From another source; from elsewhere; as, a case proved aliunde; evidence aliunde

alive.definition: Having life, in opposition to dead; living; being in a state in which the organs perform their functions; as, an animal or a plant which is alive

aliveness.definition: the condition of living or the state of being alive

alizarin.definition: A coloring principle, C14H6O2(OH)2, found in madder, and now produced artificially as an an orange-red crystalline compound from anthracene. It is used in making red pigments (such as the Turkish reds), and in dyeing

alka-seltzer.definition: a commerical antacid; -- the tablets dissolve in water to give an effervescent solution

alkahest.definition: The fabled “universal solvent” of the alchemists; a menstruum capable of dissolving all bodies

alkalamide.definition: One of a series of compounds that may be regarded as ammonia in which a part of the hydrogen has been replaced by basic, and another part by acid, atoms or radicals

alkalescence.definition: A tendency to become alkaline; or the state of a substance in which alkaline properties begin to be developed, or to predominant

alkalescent.definition: Tending to the properties of an alkali; slightly alkaline

alkali.definition: Soda ash; caustic soda, caustic potash, etc

alkali flat.definition: A sterile plain, containing an excess of alkali, at the bottom of an undrained basin in an arid region; a playa

alkali metal.definition: Any one of the univalent metals of group I of the periodic table of the elements, including lithium, sodium, potassium, rubidium, cesium, and francium.  The hydroxides of these metals are soluble in water and form strongly basic solutions

alkali soil.definition: Any one of various soils found in arid and semiarid regions, containing an unusual amount of soluble mineral salts which effloresce in the form of a powder or crust (usually white) in dry weather following rains or irrigation. The basis of these salts is mainly soda with a smaller amount of potash, and usually a little lime and  magnesia. Two main classes of alkali are commonly distinguished: black alkali, which may be any alkaline carbonate, but which practically consists of sodium carbonate (sal soda), which is highly corrosive and destructive to vegetation; and white alkali, characterized by the presence of sodium sulphate (Glauber's salt), which is less injurious to vegetation. Black alkali is so called because water containing it dissolves humus, forming a dark-colored solution which, when it collects in puddles and evaporates, produces characteristic black spots

alkali waste.definition: Waste material from the manufacture of alkali; specif., soda waste

alkalic.definition: having the properties of an alkali.  Opposite of acidic

alkalifiable.definition: Capable of being alkalified, or converted into an alkali

alkalify.definition: To convert into an alkali; to give alkaline properties to

alkalimeter.definition: An instrument to ascertain the strength of alkalies, or the quantity of alkali in a mixture

alkalimetry.definition: The art or process of ascertaining the strength of alkalies, or the quantity present in alkaline mixtures

alkaline.definition: Of or pertaining to an alkali or to alkalies; having the properties of an alkali

alkaline-loving.definition: thriving in a relatively alkaline environment; (especially of plants requiring a pH above 7)

alkalinity.definition: The quality which constitutes an alkali; alkaline property

alkalization.definition: The act of rendering alkaline by impregnating with an alkali; a conferring of alkaline qualities

alkalize.definition: To render alkaline; to communicate the properties of an alkali to

alkaloid.definition: Pertaining to, resembling, or containing, alkali

alkalosis.definition: abnormally high alkalinity in the blood and other body fluids

alkane.definition: a non-aromatic saturated acyclic hydrocarbon with the general formula CnH(2n+2).  A member of the alkane series

alkane series.definition: a series of acyclic non-aromatic saturated hydrocarbons with the general formula CnH(2n+2). They include methane, ethane, propane, butane, and the paraffins

alkanet.definition: A dyeing matter extracted from the roots of Alkanna tinctoria, which gives a fine deep red color

alkarsin.definition: A spontaneously inflammable liquid, having a repulsive odor, and consisting of cacodyl and its oxidation products; -- called also Cadel's fuming liquid

alkekengi.definition: An herbaceous plant of the nightshade family (Physalis alkekengi) and its fruit, which is a well flavored berry, the size of a cherry, loosely inclosed in a enlarged leafy calyx; -- also called winter cherry, ground cherry, and strawberry tomato

alkermes.definition: A compound cordial, in the form of a confection, deriving its name from the kermes insect, its principal ingredient

alkoran.definition: The Muslim Scriptures. Same as Alcoran and Koran

all.definition: The whole quantity, extent, duration, amount, quality, or degree of; the whole; the whole number of; any whatever; every; as, all the wheat; all the land; all the year; all the strength; all happiness; all abundance; loss of all power; beyond all doubt; you will see us all (or all of us)

all fools' day.definition: The first day of April, a day on which sportive impositions are practiced

all fours.definition: All four legs of a quadruped; or the two legs and two arms of a person

all hail.definition: All health; -- a phrase of salutation or welcome

all right.definition: satisfactory; better than average; as, everything is all right

all saints.definition: The first day of November, called, also, Allhallows or Hallowmas; a feast day kept in honor of all the saints; also, the season of this festival

all souls' day.definition: The second day of November; a feast day of the Roman Catholic church, on which supplications are made for the souls of the faithful dead

all-devouring.definition: both plant- and flesh-eating; -- said of animals

all-mains.definition: adaptable to all voltages; -- of a radio receiver

all-possessed.definition: Controlled by an evil spirit or by evil passions; wild

all-powerful.definition: having full power over all aspects of a situation

all-purpose.definition: not limited in use or function

all-rounder.definition: a versatile person who is expert at many things

all-time.definition: unsurpassed in some respect up to the present

alla breve.definition: With one breve, or four minims, to measure, and sung faster like four crotchets; in quick common time; -- indicated in the time signature by &unr_

allah.definition: The name of the Supreme Being, in use among the Arabs and the Muslims generally

allanite.definition: A silicate containing a large amount of cerium. It is usually black in color, opaque, and is related to epidote in form and composition

allantoic.definition: Pertaining to, or contained in, the allantois

allantoidea.definition: The division of Vertebrata in which the embryo develops an allantois. It includes reptiles, birds, and mammals

allantoin.definition: A crystalline, transparent, colorless substance found in the allantoic liquid of the fetal calf; -- formerly called allantoic acid and amniotic acid

allantois.definition: A membranous appendage of the embryos of mammals, birds, and reptiles, -- in mammals serving to connect the fetus with the parent; the urinary vesicle

allay.definition: To make quiet or put at rest; to pacify or appease; to quell; to calm; as, to allay popular excitement; to allay the tumult of the passions

allayer.definition: One who, or that which, allays

allayment.definition: An allaying; that which allays; mitigation

allecret.definition: A kind of light armor used in the sixteenth century, esp. by the Swiss

allegation.definition: The act of alleging or positively asserting

allege.definition: To bring forward with positiveness; to declare; to affirm; to assert; as, to allege a fact

allegeable.definition: Capable of being alleged or affirmed

alleghenian.definition: Pertaining to or designating the humid division of the Transition zone extending across the northern United States from New England to eastern Dakota, and including also most of Pennsylvania and the mountainous region as far south as northern Georgia

allegheny.definition: Of or pertaining to the Allegheny Mountains, or the region where they are situated. Also Al"le*gha`ny

allegiance.definition: The tie or obligation, implied or expressed, which a subject owes to his sovereign or government; the duty of fidelity to one's king, government, or state

allegoric.definition: Belonging to, or consisting of, allegory; of the nature of an allegory; describing by resemblances; figurative

allegorist.definition: One who allegorizes; a writer of allegory

allegorization.definition: The act of turning into allegory, or of understanding in an allegorical sense

allegorize.definition: To form or turn into allegory; as, to allegorize the history of a people

allegorizer.definition: One who allegorizes, or turns things into allegory; an allegorist

allegory.definition: A figurative sentence or discourse, in which the principal subject is described by another subject resembling it in its properties and circumstances. The real subject is thus kept out of view, and we are left to collect the intentions of the writer or speaker by the resemblance of the secondary to the primary subject

allegretto.definition: Quicker than andante, but not so quick as allegro

allele.definition: one of two or more alternative forms of a gene that can have the same place on homologous chromosomes and are responsible for alternative traits

allelomorph.definition: One of the pure unit characters commonly existing singly or in pairs in the germ cells of Mendelian hybrids, and exhibited in varying proportion among the organisms themselves; same as allele, 2. Allelomorphs which under certain circumstances are themselves compound are called hypallelomorphs. See Mendel's law

allelomorphic.definition: of, pertaining to, or characteristic of an allelomorph

alleluia.definition: An exclamation signifying Praise ye Jehovah. Hence: A song of praise to God. See Hallelujah, the commoner form

allemande.definition: A dance in moderate twofold time, invented by the French in the reign of Louis XIV.; -- now mostly found in suites of pieces, like those of Bach and Handel

allergenic.definition: of or pertaining to allergens or allergenicity

allergist.definition: a physician skilled in the diagnosis and treatment of allergies

allerion.definition: Am eagle without beak or feet, with expanded wings

alleviate.definition: To lighten or lessen the force or weight of

alleviation.definition: The act of alleviating; a lightening of weight or severity; mitigation; relief

alleviator.definition: One who, or that which, alleviates

alley.definition: A narrow passage; especially a walk or passage in a garden or park, bordered by rows of trees or bushes; a bordered way

alleyed.definition: Furnished with alleys; forming an alley

allfours.definition: A game at cards, called “High, Low, Jack, and the Game.”

allhallow eve.definition: The evening before Allhallows. See Halloween

allhallown.definition: Of or pertaining to the time of Allhallows. [Obs.] “Allhallown summer.” Shak. (i. e., late summer; “Indian Summer”)

allhallowtide.definition: The time at or near All Saints, or November 1st

allheal.definition: A name popularly given to the officinal valerian, and to some other plants

alliaceous.definition: Of or pertaining to the genus Allium, or garlic, onions, leeks, etc.; having the smell or taste of garlic or onions

alliance.definition: The state of being allied; the act of allying or uniting; a union or connection of interests between families, states, parties, etc., especially between families by marriage and states by compact, treaty, or league; as, matrimonial alliances; an alliance between church and state; an alliance between France and England

allice.definition: The European shad (Clupea vulgaris); allice shad. See Alose

allied.definition: United; joined; leagued; akin; related. See Ally

alligate.definition: To tie; to unite by some tie

alligation.definition: The act of tying together or attaching by some bond, or the state of being attached

alligator.definition: A large carnivorous reptile of the Crocodile family, peculiar to America. It has a shorter and broader snout than the crocodile, and the large teeth of the lower jaw shut into pits in the upper jaw, which has no marginal notches. Besides the common species of the southern United States, there are allied species in South America

alligator wrench.definition: A kind of pipe wrench having a flaring jaw with teeth on one side

alligatored.definition: having cracks in a reticulated pattern, giving an appearance reminiscent of alligator hide; -- said of a surface coating, e.g., of paint, varnish, or glazing

alligatoridae.definition: the family of reptiles comprising the alligators, and including the caimans

allineation.definition: Alignment; position in a straight line, as of two planets with the sun

allionia.definition: a small genus of chiefly American herbs

allision.definition: The act of dashing against, or striking upon

alliteral.definition: Pertaining to, or characterized by alliteration

alliterate.definition: To employ or place so as to make alliteration

alliteration.definition: The repetition of the same letter at the beginning of two or more words immediately succeeding each other, or at short intervals; as in the following lines: -

alliterative.definition: Pertaining to, or characterized by, alliteration; as, alliterative poetry

allium.definition: A genus of plants, including the onion, garlic, leek, chive, etc

allnight.definition: Light, fuel, or food for the whole night

allocate.definition: To distribute or assign; to allot

allocation.definition: The act of putting one thing to another; a placing; disposition; arrangement

allocatur.definition: “Allowed.” The word allocatur expresses the allowance of a proceeding, writ, order, etc., by a court, judge, or judicial officer

allocution.definition: The act or manner of speaking to, or of addressing in words

allodial.definition: Pertaining to allodium; freehold; free of rent or service; held independent of a lord paramount; -- opposed to feudal; as, allodial lands; allodial system

allodium.definition: Freehold estate; land which is the absolute property of the owner; real estate held in absolute independence, without being subject to any rent, service, or acknowledgment to a superior. It is thus opposed to feud

allogamy.definition: Fertilization of the pistil of a plant by pollen from another of the same species; cross-fertilization

allograph.definition: A writing or signature made by some person other than any of the parties thereto; -- opposed to autograph

allographic.definition: of or pertaining to an allograph

allomerism.definition: Variability in chemical constitution without variation in crystalline form

allometry.definition: the study of the relative growth of a part of an organism in relation to the growth of the whole

allomorph.definition: Any one of two or more distinct crystalline forms of the same substance; or the substance having such forms; -- as, carbonate of lime occurs in the allomorphs calcite and aragonite

allomorphism.definition: The property which constitutes an allomorph; the change involved in becoming an allomorph

allonge.definition: A thrust or pass; a lunge

allonym.definition: The name of another person assumed by the author of a work

allonymous.definition: Published under the name of some one other than the author

alloo.definition: To incite dogs by a call; to halloo

allopathically.definition: In a manner conformable to allopathy; by allopathic methods

allopathist.definition: One who practices allopathy; one who professes allopathy

allopathy.definition: That system of medical practice which aims to combat disease by the use of remedies which produce effects different from those produced by the special disease treated; -- a term invented by Hahnemann to designate the ordinary practice, as opposed to homeopathy

allophone.definition: any one of two or more speech sounds that considered variants of the same phoneme.  For example, the p sounds of pin and spin are allophones of p; and the t sounds of toe stop and catnip  are allophones of t

allophonic.definition: of or pertaining to an allophone

allophylic.definition: Pertaining to a race or a language neither Aryan nor Semitic

alloquy.definition: A speaking to another; an address

allotriophagy.definition: A depraved appetite; a desire for strange or nonnutritious food, such as clay or starch.  Called also pica

allotrophic.definition: Changed or modified in nutritive power by the process of digestion

allotropism.definition: The property of existing in two or more conditions which are distinct in their physical or chemical relations

allotropize.definition: To change in physical properties but not in substance

allottee.definition: One to whom anything is allotted; one to whom an allotment is made

allow.definition: To praise; to approve of; hence, to sanction

allowableness.definition: The quality of being allowable; permissibleness; lawfulness; exemption from prohibition or impropriety

alloxan.definition: An oxidation product of uric acid. It is of a pale reddish color, readily soluble in water or alcohol

alloxanate.definition: A combination of alloxanic acid and a base or base or positive radical

alloxanic.definition: Of or pertaining to alloxan; -- applied to an acid obtained by the action of soluble alkalies on alloxan

alloxantin.definition: A substance produced by acting upon uric with warm and very dilute nitric acid

alloy.definition: Any combination or compound of metals fused together; a mixture of metals; for example, brass, which is an alloy of copper and zinc. But when mercury is one of the metals, the compound is called an amalgam

alloy steel.definition: Any steel containing a notable quantity of some other metal alloyed with the iron, usually chromium, nickel, manganese, tungsten, or vanadium

alloyage.definition: The act or art of alloying metals; also, the combination or alloy

allspice.definition: The berry of the pimento (Eugenia pimenta), a tree of the West Indies; a spice of a mildly pungent taste, and agreeably aromatic; Jamaica pepper; pimento. It has been supposed to combine the flavor of cinnamon, nutmegs, and cloves; and hence the name. The name is also given to other aromatic shrubs; as, the Carolina allspice (Calycanthus floridus); wild allspice (Lindera benzoin), called also spicebush, spicewood, and feverbush

allude.definition: To refer to something indirectly or by suggestion; to have reference to a subject not specifically and plainly mentioned; -- followed by to; as, the story alludes to a recent transaction

allumette.definition: A match for lighting candles, lamps, etc

alluminor.definition: An illuminator of manuscripts and books; a limner

allure.definition: To attempt to draw; to tempt by a lure or bait, that is, by the offer of some good, real or apparent; to invite by something flattering or acceptable; to entice; to attract

allurer.definition: One who, or that which, allures

allusively.definition: Figuratively [Obs.]; by way of allusion; by implication, suggestion, or insinuation

alluvial.definition: Alluvial soil; specif., in Australia, gold-bearing alluvial soil

alluvion.definition: Wash or flow of water against the shore or bank

alluvium.definition: Deposits of earth, sand, gravel, and other transported matter, made by rivers, floods, or other causes, upon land not permanently submerged beneath the waters of lakes or seas

allwork.definition: Domestic or other work of all kinds; as, a maid of allwork, that is, a general servant

ally.definition: To unite, or form a connection between, as between families by marriage, or between princes and states by treaty, league, or confederacy; -- often followed by to or with

allyl.definition: An organic radical, C3H5, existing especially in oils of garlic and mustard

allylene.definition: A gaseous hydrocarbon, C3H4, homologous with acetylene; propine

alma mater.definition: A college or seminary where one is educated

almadia.definition: A bark canoe used by the Africans

almagest.definition: The celebrated work of Ptolemy of Alexandria, which contains nearly all that is known of the astronomical observations and theories of the ancients. The name was extended to other similar works

almagra.definition: A fine, deep red ocher, somewhat purplish, found in Spain. It is the sil atticum of the ancients. Under the name of Indian red it is used for polishing glass and silver

almanac.definition: A book or table, containing a calendar of days, and months, to which astronomical data and various statistics are often added, such as the times of the rising and setting of the sun and moon, eclipses, hours of full tide, stated festivals of churches, terms of courts, etc

almandine.definition: The common red variety of garnet

alme.definition: An Egyptian dancing girl; an Alma

almightiness.definition: Omnipotence; infinite or boundless power; unlimited might

almighty.definition: Unlimited in might; omnipotent; all-powerful; irresistible

almond.definition: The fruit of the almond tree

almond furnace.definition: A kind of furnace used in refining, to separate the metal from cinders and other foreign matter

almond-shaped.definition: having the shape of an almond, i.e. ellipsoidal with somewhat pointed ends

almoner.definition: One who distributes alms, esp. the doles and alms of religious houses, almshouses, etc.; also, one who dispenses alms for another, as the almoner of a prince, bishop, etc

almonry.definition: The place where an almoner resides, or where alms are distributed

almost.definition: Nearly; well nigh; all but; for the greatest part

alms.definition: Anything given gratuitously to relieve the poor, as money, food, or clothing; a gift of charity

almshouse.definition: A house appropriated for the use of the poor; a poorhouse

almucantar.definition: A small circle of the sphere parallel to the horizon; a circle or parallel of altitude. Two stars which have the same almucantar have the same altitude. See Almacantar

almude.definition: A measure for liquids in several countries. In Portugal the Lisbon almude is about 4.4, and the Oporto almude about 6.6, gallons U. S. measure.  In Turkey the “almud” is about 1.4 gallons

almug.definition: A tree or wood of the Bible (2 Chron. ii. 8; 1 K. x. 11)

alnage.definition: Measurement (of cloth) by the ell; also, a duty for such measurement

alnager.definition: A measure by the ell; formerly a sworn officer in England, whose duty was to inspect and measure woolen cloth, and fix upon it a seal

alocasia.definition: any plant of the genus Alocasia having large showy basal leaves and boat-shaped spathe and reddish berries

aloeaceae.definition: One of many families or subfamilies into which some classification systems subdivide the Liliaceae but not widely accepted

aloes.definition: a purgative made from the leaves of aloe.  Same as aloe{3}

aloetic.definition: Consisting chiefly of aloes; of the nature of aloes

aloft.definition: On high; in the air; high above the ground

alogian.definition: One of an ancient sect who rejected St. John's Gospel and the Apocalypse, which speak of Christ as the Logos

aloin.definition: A bitter purgative principle in aloes

alone.definition: Quite by one's self; apart from, or exclusive of, others; single; solitary; -- applied to a person or thing

aloneness.definition: A state of being alone, or without company; solitariness

along.definition: By the length; in a line with the length; lengthwise

alongside.definition: Along or by the side; side by side with; -- often with of; as, bring the boat alongside; alongside of him; alongside of the tree

alopecist.definition: A practitioner who tries to prevent or cure baldness

alopiidae.definition: a family of fish comprising the thresher sharks

alopius.definition: type genus of the family Alopiidae; in some classifications considered a genus of the family Lamnidae

alosa.definition: the genus comprising the most common varieties of shad.  It replaces the older term Clupea.  See also shad

alouatta.definition: One of the several species of howling monkeys of South America. See Howler{2}

aloud.definition: With a loud voice, or great noise; loudly; audibly

alp.definition: A very high mountain. Specifically, in the plural, the highest chain of mountains in Europe, containing the lofty mountains of Switzerland, etc

alpaca.definition: An animal of Peru (Lama paco), having long, fine, wooly hair, supposed by some to be a domesticated variety of the llama

alpen.definition: Of or pertaining to the Alps

alpenglow.definition: A reddish glow seen near sunset or sunrise on the summits of mountains; specif., a reillumination sometimes observed after the summits have passed into shadow, supposed to be due to a curving downward (refraction) of the light rays from the west resulting from the cooling of the air

alpenhorn.definition: A curved wooden horn about three feet long, with a cupped mouthpiece and a bell, used by the Swiss to sound the ranz des vaches and other melodies. Its notes are open harmonics of the tube

alpenstock.definition: A long staff, pointed with iron, used in climbing the Alps

alpestrine.definition: Pertaining to the Alps, or other high mountains; as, Alpestrine diseases, etc

alpha.definition: The first letter in the Greek alphabet, answering to A, and hence used to denote the beginning

alpha paper.definition: A sensitized paper for obtaining positives by artificial light. It is coated with gelatin containing silver bromide and chloride

alpha particle.definition: a particle emitted at high velocity from certain radioactive substances.  It is identical to the helium nucleus, consisting of two protons and two neutrons.  Rays of such particles are called alpha rays

alpha rays.definition: Rays of relatively low penetrating power emitted by radium and other radioactive substances, and shown to consist of positively charged alpha particles (helium nuclei) having enormous velocities but small masses. They are slightly deflected by a strong magnetic or electric field.  Compare beta ray and gamma ray.  Because the rays penetrate only a small distance in dense matter such as living tissue, small pellets of radioactive substances emitting alpha rays have been used to cause local destruction of tissue, as in cancer therapy

alphabet.definition: The letters of a language arranged in the customary order; the series of letters or signs which form the elements of written language

alphabetarian.definition: A learner of the alphabet; an abecedarian

alphabetic.definition: Pertaining to, furnished with, expressed by, or in the order of, the letters of the alphabet; as, alphabetic characters, writing, languages, arrangement

alphabetically.definition: In an alphabetic manner; in the customary order of the letters

alphabetics.definition: The science of representing spoken sounds by letters

alphabetism.definition: The expression of spoken sounds by an alphabet

alphabetize.definition: To arrange alphabetically; as, to alphabetize a list of words

alphanumerics.definition: a character set that includes letters and digits and punctuation marks

alphitomancy.definition: Divination by means of barley meal

alphol.definition: A crystalline derivative of salicylic acid, used as an antiseptic and antirheumatic

alphonsine.definition: Of or relating to Alphonso X., the Wise, King of Castile (1252-1284)

alpine.definition: Of or pertaining to the Alps, or to any lofty mountain; as, Alpine snows; Alpine plants

alpinia.definition: a genus of perennial rhizomatous herbs of Asia and Australia and Polynesia having ginger-scented rhizomes

alpist.definition: The seed of canary grass (Phalaris Canariensis), used for feeding cage birds

alquifou.definition: A lead ore found in Cornwall, England, and used by potters to give a green glaze to their wares; potter's ore

already.definition: Prior to some specified time, either past, present, or future; by this time; previously

alsace.definition: a region of northeastern France famous for its wines

alsatia.definition: a region of northeastern France famous for its wines

alsike.definition: A species of clover with pinkish or white flowers; Trifolium hybridum

alsobia.definition: a genus of tropical American herbs sometimes included in genus Episcia

alsophila.definition: a genus comprising the geometrid moths

alstonia.definition: genus of evergreen trees or shrubs with white funnel-shaped flowers and milky sap; tropical Africa to southeast Asia and Polynesia

alstroemeria.definition: any of various South American plants of the genus Alstroemeria valued for their handsome umbels of beautiful flowers

alstroemeriaceae.definition: one of many families or subfamilies into which some classification systems subdivide the Liliaceae but not widely accepted; sometimes included in subfamily Amaryllidaceae

alt.definition: The higher part of the scale. See Alto

altaian.definition: Of or pertaining to the Altai, a mountain chain in Central Asia

altar.definition: A raised structure (as a square or oblong erection of stone or wood) on which sacrifices are offered or incense burned to a deity

altar boy.definition: a boy who assists a priest at the clebration of the Holy Mass and other forms of public worship; -- also called acolyte

altarage.definition: The offerings made upon the altar, or to a church

altarpiece.definition: The painting or piece of sculpture above and behind the altar; reredos

altarwise.definition: In the proper position of an altar, that is, at the east of a church with its ends towards the north and south

altazimuth.definition: An instrument for taking azimuths and altitudes simultaneously

alter.definition: To make otherwise; to change in some respect, either partially or wholly; to vary; to modify

alterability.definition: The quality of being alterable; alterableness

alterableness.definition: The quality of being alterable; variableness; alterability

alteration.definition: The act of altering or making different

altercate.definition: To contend in words; to dispute with zeal, heat, or anger; to wrangle

altercation.definition: Warm contention in words; dispute carried on with heat or anger; controversy; wrangle; wordy contest

alterity.definition: The state or quality of being other; a being otherwise

alternant.definition: Composed of alternate layers, as some rocks

alternat.definition: A usage, among diplomats, of rotation in precedence among representatives of equal rank, sometimes determined by lot and at other times in regular order. The practice obtains in the signing of treaties and conventions between nations

alternate.definition: Being or succeeding by turns; one following the other in succession of time or place; by turns first one and then the other; hence, reciprocal

alternately.definition: In reciprocal succession; succeeding by turns; in alternate order

alternateness.definition: The quality of being alternate, or of following by turns

alternating current.definition: A current which periodically changes or reverses its direction of flow, especially an electric current that reverses direction sinusoidally, as is used for most domestic and industrial power requirements.  Contrasted with direct curent

alternation.definition: The reciprocal succession of things in time or place; the act of following and being followed by turns; alternate succession, performance, or occurrence; as, the alternation of day and night, cold and heat, summer and winter, hope and fear

alternative.definition: Offering a choice of two things

alternatively.definition: In the manner of alternatives, or that admits the choice of one out of two things

alternativeness.definition: The quality of being alternative, or of offering a choice between two

alternator.definition: An electric generator or dynamo for producing alternating currents

althaea.definition: A genus of plants of the Mallow family. It includes the officinal marsh mallow, and the garden hollyhocks

althing.definition: The national assembly or parliament of Iceland. See Thing, n., 8

althorn.definition: An instrument of the saxhorn family, used exclusively in military music, often replacing the French horn

although.definition: Grant all this; be it that; supposing that; notwithstanding; though

altimeter.definition: An instrument for taking altitudes, as a quadrant, sextant, etc

altimetry.definition: The art of measuring altitudes, or heights

altiscope.definition: An arrangement of lenses and mirrors which enables a person to see an object in spite of intervening objects.  Since the early 1900's, most commonly called periscope

altissimo.definition: The part or notes situated above F in alt

altitude.definition: Space extended upward; height; the perpendicular elevation of an object above its foundation, above the ground, or above a given level, or of one object above another; as, the altitude of a mountain, or of a bird above the top of a tree

altitudinal.definition: Of or pertaining to height; as, altitudinal measurements

alto.definition: Formerly the part sung by the highest male, or counter-tenor, voices; now the part sung by the lowest female, or contralto, voices, between in tenor and soprano. In instrumental music it now signifies the tenor

alto-cumulus.definition: A fleecy cloud formation consisting of large whitish or grayish globular cloudlets with shaded  portions, often grouped in flocks or rows

alto-rilievo.definition: High relief; sculptured work in which the figures project more than half their thickness; as, this figure is an alto-rilievo or in alto-rilievo

altostratus.definition: A cloud formation similar to cirro-stratus, but heavier and at a lower level; a stratus cloud at an intermediate altitude of 2 or 3 miles

altrices.definition: Nursers, -- a term applied to those birds whose young are hatched in a very immature and helpless condition, so as to require the care of their parents for some time; -- opposed to præcoces

altricial.definition: born naked and blind and dependent on parents for food; -- of hatchlings.  Opposite of precocial

altruism.definition: Regard for others, both natural and moral; devotion to the interests of others; brotherly kindness; -- opposed to egoism or selfishness

altruist.definition: One imbued with altruism; -- opposed to egoist

altruistic.definition: Regardful of others; beneficent; unselfish; -- opposed to egoistic or selfish

aludel.definition: One of the pear-shaped pots open at both ends, and so formed as to be fitted together, the neck of one into the bottom of another in succession; -- used in the process of sublimation

alula.definition: A false or bastard wing. See under Bastard

alum.definition: A double sulphate formed of aluminium and some other element (esp. an alkali metal) or of aluminium. It has twenty-four molecules of water of crystallization

alum root.definition: A North American herb (Heuchera Americana) of the Saxifrage family, whose root has astringent properties

alum schist.definition: A variety of shale or clay slate, containing iron pyrites, the decomposition of which leads to the formation of alum, which often effloresces on the rock

alum stone.definition: A subsulphate of alumina and potash; alunite

alumina.definition: One of the earths, consisting of two parts of aluminium and three of oxygen, Al2O3

aluminate.definition: A compound formed from the hydrate of aluminium by the substitution of a metal for the hydrogen

aluminic.definition: Of or containing aluminium; as, aluminic phosphate

aluminium.definition: same as aluminum, chiefly British in usage

aluminize.definition: To treat or impregnate with alum; to alum

aluminography.definition: Art or process of producing, and printing from, aluminium plates, after the manner of ordinary lithography

aluminous.definition: Pertaining to or containing alum, or alumina; as, aluminous minerals, aluminous solution

aluminum.definition: The metallic element forming the base of alumina. This metal is white, but with a bluish tinge, and is remarkable for its resistance to oxidation, and for its lightness, having a specific gravity of about 2.6. Atomic weight 27.08. Symbol Al.  Also called aluminium

alumna.definition: A female pupil; especially, a graduate of a school or college

alumnus.definition: A pupil; especially, a graduate of a college or other seminary of learning

alunogen.definition: A white fibrous mineral frequently found on the walls of mines and quarries, chiefly hydrous sulphate of alumina; -- also called feather alum, and hair salt

alure.definition: A walk or passage; -- applied to passages of various kinds

alutation.definition: The tanning or dressing of leather

alveary.definition: A beehive, or something resembling a beehive

alveated.definition: Formed or vaulted like a beehive

alveolar.definition: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, alveoli or little cells, sacs, or sockets

alveoliform.definition: Having the form of alveoli, or little sockets, cells, or cavities

alvine.definition: Of, from, in, or pertaining to, the belly or the intestines; as, alvine discharges; alvine concretions

always.definition: At all times; ever; perpetually; throughout all time; continually; as, God is always the same

alyssum.definition: A genus of cruciferous plants; madwort. The sweet alyssum (Alyssum maritimum), cultivated for bouquets, bears small, white, sweet-scented flowers

alytes.definition: a genus of amphibians comprising the midwife toads

am.definition: The first person singular of the verb be, in the indicative mode, present tense. See Be

amadavat.definition: The strawberry finch, a small Indian song bird (Estrelda amandava), commonly caged and kept for fighting. The female is olive brown; the male, in summer, mostly crimson; -- called also red waxbill

amadou.definition: A spongy, combustible substance, prepared from fungus (Boletus and Polyporus) which grows on old trees; German tinder; punk. It has been employed as a styptic by surgeons, but its common use is as tinder, for which purpose it is prepared by soaking it in a strong solution of niter

amah.definition: a woman hired to suckle a child of someone else

amain.definition: With might; with full force; vigorously; violently; exceedingly

amalgam.definition: An alloy of mercury with another metal or metals; as, an amalgam of tin, bismuth, etc

amalgamate.definition: To compound or mix, as quicksilver, with another metal; to unite, combine, or alloy with mercury

amalgamation.definition: The act or operation of compounding mercury with another metal; -- applied particularly to the process of separating gold and silver from their ores by mixing them with mercury

amalgamator.definition: One who, or that which, amalgamates. Specifically: A machine for separating precious metals from earthy particles by bringing them in contact with a body of mercury with which they form an amalgam

amanita.definition: A genus of poisonous fungi of the family Agaricaceæ, characterized by having a volva, an annulus, and white spores. The species resemble edible mushrooms, and are frequently mistaken for them. Amanita muscaria, syn. Agaricus muscarius, is the fly amanita, or fly agaric; and Agaricus phalloides is the death cup (or death cap)

amanitine.definition: The poisonous principle of some fungi

amanuensis.definition: A person whose employment is to write what another dictates, or to copy what another has written

amarantaceous.definition: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, the family of plants of which the amaranth is the type

amaranth.definition: An imaginary flower supposed never to fade

amaranthaceae.definition: a cosmopolitan family of herbs and shrubs

amarelle.definition: any of several varieties of cultivated sour cherry trees of the species Prunus cerasus bearing fruit with colorless juice, e.g. Prunus cerasus caproniana

amarine.definition: A characteristic crystalline substance, obtained from oil of bitter almonds
