amaryllidaceae.definition: a family of flowering plants including the snowdrop, narcissus, and daffodil; in some classification systems considered a subfamily of the Liliaceae

amaryllidaceous.definition: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, an order of plants differing from the lily family chiefly in having the ovary below the petals. The narcissus and daffodil are members of this family

amass.definition: To collect into a mass or heap; to gather a great quantity of; to accumulate; as, to amass a treasure or a fortune; to amass words or phrases

amassette.definition: An instrument of horn used for collecting painters' colors on the stone in the process of grinding

amassment.definition: An amassing; a heap collected; a large quantity or number brought together; an accumulation

amasthenic.definition: Uniting the chemical rays of light into one focus, as a certain kind of lens; amacratic

amate.definition: To dismay; to dishearten; to daunt

amateur.definition: A person attached to a particular pursuit, study, or science as to music or painting; esp. one who cultivates any study or art, from taste or attachment, without pursuing it professionally

amateurish.definition: In the style of an amateur; superficial or defective like the work of an amateur

amateurishness.definition: Behavior that demonstrates a lack of professional competency

amateurism.definition: The practice, habit, or work of an amateur

amateurship.definition: The quality or character of an amateur

amativeness.definition: The faculty supposed to influence sexual desire; propensity to love

amatorial.definition: Of or pertaining to a lover or to love making; amatory; as, amatorial verses

amatory.definition: Pertaining to, producing, or expressing, sexual love; as, amatory potions

amatungulu.definition: a very large closely branched South African shrub (Carissa grandiflora) of the dogbane family having forked bright green spines, white flowers, shiny leaves, and red berries.  Also called natal plum

amauropelta.definition: a genus of epiphytic or terrestrial ferns of America and Africa and Polynesia

amaurosis.definition: A loss or decay of sight as the result of a neurological disease, without any perceptible changes in the eye; -- called also gutta serena, the “drop serene” of Milton

amaurotic.definition: Affected with amaurosis; having the characteristics of amaurosis

amaze.definition: To bewilder; to stupefy; to bring into a maze

amazedly.definition: In amazement; with confusion or astonishment

amazedness.definition: The state of being amazed, or confounded with fear, surprise, or wonder

amazement.definition: The condition of being amazed; bewilderment [Obs.]; overwhelming wonder, as from surprise, sudden fear, horror, or admiration

amazing.definition: Causing amazement; very wonderful; as, amazing grace

amazon.definition: One of a fabulous race of female warriors in Scythia; hence, a female warrior

amazonian.definition: Pertaining to or resembling an Amazon; of masculine manners; warlike

amazonite.definition: A variety of feldspar, having a verdigris-green color

amb-.definition: A prefix meaning about, around; -- used in words derived from the Latin

ambages.definition: A circuit; a winding. Hence: Circuitous way or proceeding; quibble; circumlocution; indirect mode of speech

ambary.definition: A valuable East Indian fiber plant (Hibiscus cannabinus), or its fiber, which is used throughout India for making ropes, cordage, and a coarse canvas and sackcloth; -- called also brown Indian hemp

ambassador.definition: A minister of the highest rank sent to a foreign court to represent there his sovereign or country

ambassadorial.definition: Of or pertaining to an ambassador

ambassadorship.definition: The state, office, or functions of an ambassador

ambassadress.definition: A female ambassador; also, the wife of an ambassador

amber.definition: A yellowish translucent resin resembling copal, found as a fossil in alluvial soils, with beds of lignite, or on the seashore in many places. It takes a fine polish, and is used for pipe mouthpieces, beads, etc., and as a basis for a fine varnish. By friction, it becomes strongly electric

amber room.definition: A room formerly in the Czar's Summer Palace in Russia, which was richly decorated with walls and fixtures made from amber.  The amber was removed by occupying German troops during the Second World War and has, as of 1997, never been recovered.  The room is being recreated from old photographs by Russian artisans

amber seed.definition: Seed of the Hibiscus abelmoschus, somewhat resembling millet, brought from Egypt and the West Indies, and having a flavor like that of musk; musk seed

amber tree.definition: A species of Anthospermum, a shrub with evergreen leaves, which, when bruised, emit a fragrant odor

amberboa.definition: a genus of herbs of Mediterranean to Central Asia cultivated for their flowers

amberfish.definition: Any of several amber to coppery fork-tailed warm-water carangid fishes of the genus Seriola, especially a large vigorous sport fish of the southern Atlantic coast (Seriola Dumerili).  It is also called the amberjack

ambergris.definition: A substance of the consistence of wax, found floating in the Indian Ocean and other parts of the tropics, and also as a morbid secretion in the intestines of the sperm whale (Physeter macrocephalus), which is believed to be in all cases its true origin. In color it is white, ash-gray, yellow, or black, and often variegated like marble. The floating masses are sometimes from sixty to two hundred and twenty-five pounds in weight. It is wholly volatilized as a white vapor at 212° Fahrenheit, and is highly valued in perfumery

ambidexter.definition: Using both hands with equal ease

ambidexterity.definition: The quality of being ambidextrous; the faculty of using both hands with equal facility

ambidextral.definition: Pertaining equally to the right-hand side and the left-hand side

ambidextrous.definition: Having the faculty of using both hands with equal ease

ambidextrousness.definition: The quality of being ambidextrous; ambidexterity

ambient.definition: Encompassing on all sides; circumfused; investing

ambigu.definition: An entertainment at which a medley of dishes is set on at the same time

ambiguity.definition: The quality or state of being ambiguous; doubtfulness or uncertainty, particularly as to the signification of language, arising from its admitting of more than one meaning; an equivocal word or expression

ambiguous.definition: Doubtful or uncertain, particularly in respect to signification; capable of being understood in either of two or more possible senses; equivocal; as, an ambiguous course; an ambiguous expression

ambiguously.definition: In an ambiguous manner; with doubtful meaning

ambilevous.definition: Left-handed on both sides; clumsy; -- opposed to ambidexter

ambiparous.definition: Characterized by containing the rudiments of both flowers and leaves; -- applied to a bud

ambition.definition: The act of going about to solicit or obtain an office, or any other object of desire; canvassing

ambitious.definition: Possessing, or controlled by, ambition; greatly or inordinately desirous of power, honor, office, superiority, or distinction

ambitiousness.definition: The quality of being ambitious; ambition; pretentiousness

ambitus.definition: The exterior edge or border of a thing, as the border of a leaf, or the outline of a bivalve shell

ambivalence.definition: mixed feelings or emotions; uncertainty or vacillation in making a choice

ambivalent.definition: undecided as to whether or not to take a proposed course of action; having feelings both for and against the proposed action

ambiversion.definition: a balanced disposition intermediate between extroversion and introversion

ambiversive.definition: intermediate between introversive and extroversive.  Contrasted to introversive and extroversive

amble.definition: To go at the easy gait called an amble; -- applied to the horse or to its rider

ambler.definition: A horse or a person that ambles

amblygon.definition: An obtuse-angled figure, esp. and obtuse-angled triangle

amblyopia.definition: Weakness of sight, without any detectable organic lesion

amblypoda.definition: A group of large, extinct, herbivorous mammals, common in the Tertiary formation of the United States

ambo.definition: A large pulpit or reading desk, in the early Christian churches

amboyna button.definition: A chronic contagious affection of the skin, prevalent in the tropics

amboyna pine.definition: The resiniferous tree Agathis Dammara, of the Moluccas

amboyna wood.definition: A beautiful mottled and curled wood, used in cabinetwork. It is obtained from the Pterocarpus Indicus of Amboyna, Borneo, etc

ambreate.definition: A salt formed by the combination of ambreic acid with a base or positive radical

ambreic.definition: Of or pertaining to ambrein; -- said of a certain acid produced by digesting ambrein in nitric acid

ambrein.definition: A fragrant substance which is the chief constituent of ambergris

ambrite.definition: A fossil resin occurring in large masses in New Zealand

ambrose.definition: A sweet-scented herb; ambrosia. See Ambrosia, 3

ambrosia.definition: The fabled food of the gods (as nectar was their drink), which conferred immortality upon those who partook of it

ambrosia beetle.definition: A bark beetle that makes and feeds on ambrosia{4}

ambrosiac.definition: Having the qualities of ambrosia; delicious

ambrosiaceae.definition: in some classifications considered a separate family comprising a subgroup of the Compositae including the ragweeds

ambrosial.definition: Consisting of, or partaking of the nature of, ambrosia; delighting the taste or smell; delicious

ambrosially.definition: After the manner of ambrosia; delightfully

ambrosin.definition: An early coin struck by the dukes of Milan, and bearing the figure of St. Ambrose on horseback

ambrotype.definition: A picture taken on a plate of prepared glass, in which the lights are represented in silver, and the shades are produced by a dark background visible through the unsilvered portions of the glass

ambry.definition: In churches, a kind of closet, niche, cupboard, or locker for utensils, vestments, etc

ambs-ace.definition: Double aces, the lowest throw of all at dice. Hence: Bad luck; anything of no account or value

ambulacral.definition: Of or pertaining to ambulacra; avenuelike; as, the ambulacral ossicles, plates, spines, and suckers of echinoderms

ambulacrum.definition: One of the radical zones of echinoderms, along which run the principal nerves, blood vessels, and water tubes. These zones usually bear rows of locomotive suckers or tentacles, which protrude from regular pores. In star fishes they occupy the grooves along the under side of the rays

ambulance.definition: A field hospital, so organized as to follow an army in its movements, and intended to succor the wounded as soon as possible. Often used adjectively; as, an ambulance wagon; ambulance stretcher; ambulance corps

ambulant.definition: Walking; moving from place to place

ambulator.definition: One who walks about; a walker

ambulatory.definition: Of or pertaining to walking; having the faculty of walking; formed or fitted for walking; as, an ambulatory animal

ambuscade.definition: A lying in a wood, concealed, for the purpose of attacking an enemy by surprise. Hence: A lying in wait, and concealed in any situation, for a like purpose; a snare laid for an enemy; an ambush

ambush.definition: A disposition or arrangement of troops for attacking an enemy unexpectedly from a concealed station. Hence: Unseen peril; a device to entrap; a snare

ameba.definition: naked freshwater or marine or parasitic protozoa that form temporary pseudopods for feeding and locomotion.  Same as amoeba

ameban.definition: of or pertaining to amoebae.  Same as amoeban

ameboid.definition: Resembling an amoeba especially in the shape or manner of motion

ameer.definition: an independent ruler or chieftan (especially in Africa or Arabia).  Same as Emir

ameiuridae.definition: A natural family of fish comprising the North American catfishes

ameiurus.definition: the type genus of the Ameiuridae: bullhead catfishes

amelanchier.definition: a genus of North American deciduous trees or shrubs

amelcorn.definition: A variety of wheat from which starch is produced; -- called also French rice

ameliorate.definition: To make better; to improve; to meliorate

ameliorating.definition: causing improvement in or reducing the bad effects of an unfavorable condition

amelioration.definition: The act of ameliorating, or the state of being ameliorated; making or becoming better; improvement; melioration

ameliorative.definition: Tending to ameliorate; producing amelioration or improvement; as, ameliorative remedies, efforts

amen.definition: An expression used at the end of prayers, and meaning, So be it. At the end of a creed, it is a solemn asseveration of belief. When it introduces a declaration, it is equivalent to truly, verily

amen-ra.definition: The ancient Egyptian sun god; supreme god of the universe in whom Amen and Ra were combined; the principal deity during the Theban supremacy

amenability.definition: The quality of being amenable; amenableness

amenable.definition: Easy to be led; governable, as a woman by her husband

amenableness.definition: The quality or state of being amenable; liability to answer charges; answerableness

amend.definition: To change or modify in any way for the better

amendable.definition: Capable of being amended; as, an amendable writ or error

amende.definition: A pecuniary punishment or fine; a reparation or recantation

amendment.definition: An alteration or change for the better; correction of a fault or of faults; reformation of life by quitting vices

amends.definition: Compensation for a loss or injury; recompense; reparation

amenia.definition: absence or suppression of normal menstrual flow

amenities.definition: things that make you comfortable and at ease

amenity.definition: The quality of being pleasant or agreeable, whether in respect to situation, climate, manners, or disposition; pleasantness; civility; suavity; gentleness

amenorrhea.definition: Pathological or physiological absence of menstruation

ament.definition: A species of inflorescence; a catkin

amentaceous.definition: Resembling, or consisting of, an ament or aments; as, the chestnut has an amentaceous inflorescence

amentiferae.definition: used in some classification systems for plants that bear catkins

amerce.definition: To punish by a pecuniary penalty, the amount of which is not fixed by law, but left to the discretion of the court; as, the court amerced the criminal in the sum of one hundred dollars

amercement.definition: The infliction of a penalty at the discretion of the court; also, a mulct or penalty thus imposed. It differs from a fine, in that the latter is, or was originally, a fixed and certain sum prescribed by statute for an offense; but an amercement is arbitrary. Hence, the act or practice of affeering. [See Affeer.]

american.definition: Of or pertaining to America; as, the American continent: American Indians

american indian.definition: a red-skinned member of a race of people living in North America when Europeans arrived

american plan.definition: In hotels, aplan upon which guests pay for both room and board by the day, week, or other convenient period; -- contrasted with European plan

american protective association.definition: A secret organization in the United States, formed in Iowa in 1887, ostensibly for the protection of American institutions by keeping Roman Catholics out of public office. Abbrev. commonly to A. P .A

american sign language.definition: a sign language, used in the United States mostly by the deaf or for communication with the deaf, in which gestures made with the hands symbolize words, alphabetical letters, or ideas, permitting rapid communication in the absence of speech

american-indian.definition: of or pertaining to American Indians

americana.definition: any artifact (such a books or furniture or art) that is distinctive to America

americanize.definition: To render American; to assimilate to the Americans in customs, ideas, etc.; to stamp with American characteristics

amess.definition: Amice, a hood or cape. See 2d Amice

ametabola.definition: A group of insects which do not undergo any metamorphosis

ametabolian.definition: Of or pertaining to insects that do undergo any metamorphosis

ametabolic.definition: Not undergoing any metamorphosis; as, ametabolic insects.  Opposite of metabolic

amethyst.definition: A variety of crystallized quartz, of a purple or bluish violet color, of different shades. It is much used as a jeweler's stone

amethystine.definition: Resembling amethyst, especially in color; bluish violet

ametropia.definition: A visual impairment resulting from faulty refraction of light rays in the eye. Subtypes include myopia astigmatism and hyperopia

amharic.definition: Of or pertaining to Amhara, a division of Abyssinia; as, the Amharic language is closely allied to the Ethiopic

amia.definition: A genus of fresh-water ganoid fishes, exclusively confined to North America; called bowfin in Lake Champlain, dogfish in Lake Erie, and mudfish in South Carolina, etc. See Bowfin

amiability.definition: The quality of being amiable; amiableness; sweetness of disposition

amiableness.definition: The quality of being amiable; amiability

amianthus.definition: Earth flax, or mountain flax; a soft silky variety of asbestus

amic.definition: Related to, or derived, ammonia; -- used chiefly as a suffix; as, amic acid; phosphamic acid

amicability.definition: The quality of being amicable; friendliness; amicableness

amicable.definition: Friendly; proceeding from, or exhibiting, friendliness; after the manner of friends; peaceable; as, an amicable disposition, or arrangement

amicableness.definition: The quality of being amicable; amicability

amice.definition: A square of white linen worn at first on the head, but now about the neck and shoulders, by priests of the Roman Catholic Church while saying Mass

amide.definition: A compound formed by the union of amidogen with an acid element or radical. It may also be regarded as ammonia in which one or more hydrogen atoms have been replaced by an acid atom or radical

amidin.definition: Start modified by heat so as to become a transparent mass, like horn. It is soluble in cold water

amidogen.definition: A compound radical, NH2, not yet obtained in a separate state, which may be regarded as ammonia from the molecule of which one of its hydrogen atoms has been removed; -- called also the amido group, and in composition represented by the form amido

amidol.definition: A salt of a diamino phenol, C6H3(OH)(NH2)2, used as a developer

amidships.definition: In the middle of a ship, with regard to her length, and sometimes also her breadth

amidst.definition: In the midst or middle of; surrounded or encompassed by; among

amigo.definition: A friend; -- a Spanish term applied in the Philippine Islands to friendly natives

amine.definition: One of a class of basic substances derived from ammonia by replacement of one or more hydrogen atoms by an alkyl or aryl group.  Compare amide, in which an acyl group is attached to the nitrogen.  Hydroxylamine and hydrazine, which are not an organic compounds, are also basic and may also be considered amines

aminoalkane.definition: a compound derived from ammonia by replacing hydrogen atoms by univalent hydrocarbon radicals

aminobenzine.definition: an oily poisonous liquid amine obtained from nitrobenzene and used to make dyes and plastics and medicines.  Same as aniline

aminol.definition: A colorless liquid prepared from herring brine and containing amines, used as a local antiseptic

aminomethane.definition: a methyl with the hydrogen atom replaced by an amino radical

aminopyrine.definition: a white crystalline substance used as an analgesic and antipyretic

amioid.definition: Like or pertaining to the Amioidei

amioidei.definition: An order of ganoid fishes of which Amia is the type. See Bowfin and Ganoidei

amissibility.definition: The quality of being amissible; possibility of being lost

amitosis.definition: Cell division in which there is first a simple cleavage of the nucleus without change in its structure (such as the formation of chromosomes), followed by the division of the cytoplasm; direct cell division; -- opposed to mitosis. It is not the usual mode of division, and is believed by many to occur chiefly in highly specialized cells which are incapable of long-continued multiplication, in transitory structures, and in those in early stages of degeneration

amitotic.definition: Of or pertaining to amitosis; karyostenotic; -- opposed to mitotic

amity.definition: Friendship, in a general sense, between individuals, societies, or nations; friendly relations; good understanding; as, a treaty of amity and commerce; the amity of the Whigs and Tories

amman.definition: The capital city of Jordan.  Population (2000) = 963,490

ammeter.definition: A contraction of amperometer or ampèremeter

ammite.definition: Oölite or roestone; -- written also hammite

ammobium.definition: any plant of the genus Ammobium having yellow flowers and silvery foliage

ammodyte.definition: One of a genus of fishes; the sand eel

ammodytidae.definition: a family comprising the sand lances

ammonal.definition: An explosive consisting of a mixture of powdered aluminum and ammonium nitrate

ammonia.definition: A gaseous compound of hydrogen and nitrogen, NH3, with a pungent smell and taste: -- often called volatile alkali, and spirits of hartshorn.  It is very soluble in water, forming a moderately alkaline solution, and is used in aqueous solution as a household cleaning agent, such as for cleaning grease from glass

ammoniacal fermentation.definition: Any fermentation process by which ammonia is formed, as that by which urea is converted into ammonium carbonate when urine is exposed to the air

ammoniate.definition: treat with ammonia; expose to ammonia

ammonite.definition: A fossil cephalopod shell related to the nautilus. There are many genera and species, and all are extinct, the typical forms having existed only in the Mesozoic age, when they were exceedingly numerous. They differ from the nautili in having the margins of the septa very much lobed or plaited, and the siphuncle dorsal. Also called serpent stone, snake stone, and cornu Ammonis

ammonitoidea.definition: An extensive group of fossil cephalopods often very abundant in Mesozoic rocks. See Ammonite

ammonium.definition: A compound radical, NH4, having the chemical relations of a strongly basic element like the alkali metals

ammonoid.definition: one of the coiled chambered fossil shells of extinct mollusks; same as ammonite

ammunition.definition: Military stores, or provisions of all kinds for attack or defense

amnesiac.definition: Having lost memories, especially due to brain injury or mental shock; suffering from amnesia

amnesty.definition: Forgetfulness; cessation of remembrance of wrong; oblivion

amnicolist.definition: One who lives near a river

amnigenous.definition: Born or bred in, of, or near a river

amnion.definition: A thin membrane surrounding the embryos of mammals, birds, and reptiles

amniota.definition: That group of vertebrates which develops in its embryonic life the envelope called the amnion. It comprises the reptiles, the birds, and the mammals

amniotic.definition: Of or pertaining to the amnion; characterized by an amnion; as, the amniotic fluid; the amniotic sac

amoebaeum.definition: A poem in which persons are represented at speaking alternately; as the third and seventh eclogues of Virgil

amoebea.definition: That division of the Rhizopoda which includes the amoeba and similar forms

amoebiform.definition: Resembling an amœba; amœba-shaped; changing in shape like an amœba

amole.definition: Any detergent plant, or the part of it used as a detergent, as the roots of Agave Americana, Chlorogalum pomeridianum, etc

amomum.definition: A genus of aromatic plants. It includes species which bear cardamoms, and grains of paradise

amon-ra.definition: the ancient Egyptian sun god; supreme god of the universe in whom Amen and Ra were combined; principal deity during Theban supremacy

amontillado.definition: A dry kind of cherry, of a light color

amoret.definition: An amorous girl or woman; a wanton

amorosity.definition: The quality of being amorous; lovingness

amorous.definition: Inclined to love; having a propensity to love, or to sexual enjoyment; loving; fond; affectionate; as, an amorous disposition

amorousness.definition: The quality of being amorous, or inclined to sexual love; lovingness

amorpha.definition: A genus of leguminous shrubs, having long clusters of purple flowers; false or bastard indigo

amorphism.definition: A state of being amorphous; esp. a state of being without crystallization even in the minutest particles, as in glass, opal, etc

amorphophallus.definition: any plant of the genus Amorphophallus

amorphous.definition: Having no determinate form; of irregular; shapeless

amorphozoa.definition: Animals without a mouth or regular internal organs, as the sponges

amorphozoic.definition: Of or pertaining to the Amorphozoa

amort.definition: As if dead; lifeless; spiritless; dejected; depressed

amortizable.definition: Capable of being cleared off, as a debt

amortization.definition: The act or right of alienating lands to a corporation, which was considered formerly as transferring them to dead hands, or in mortmain

amortize.definition: To make as if dead; to destroy

amotion.definition: Removal; ousting; especially, the removal of a corporate officer from his office

amotus.definition: Elevated, -- as a toe, when raised so high that the tip does not touch the ground

amovability.definition: Liability to be removed or dismissed from office

amove.definition: To remove, as a person or thing, from a position

ampelite.definition: An earth abounding in pyrites, used by the ancients to kill insects, etc., on vines; -- applied by Brongniart to a carbonaceous alum schist

ampelopsis.definition: A genus formerly including the Virginia creeper

amperage.definition: The strength of a current of electricity carried by a conductor or generated by a machine, measured in ampères

ampere.definition: The unit of electric current; -- defined by the International Electrical Congress in 1893 and by U. S. Statute as, one tenth of the unit of current of the C. G. S. system of electro-magnetic units, or the practical equivalent of the unvarying current which, when passed through a standard solution of nitrate of silver in water, deposits silver at the rate of 0.001118 grams per second. Called also the international ampère

ampere foot.definition: A unit, employed in calculating fall of pressure in distributing mains, equivalent to a current of one ampère flowing through one foot of conductor

ampere hour.definition: The quantity of electricity delivered in hour by a current whose average strength is one ampère.  It is used as a unit of charge quantity; the Ampere hour is equal to 3600 coulombs.  The terms Ampère minute and Ampère second are sometimes similarly used

ampere-second.definition: a unit of charge equal to that acquired by the accumulation of one ampere for one second

ampere-turn.definition: A unit of magnetomotive force equal to the product of one complete convolution (of a coiled conductor) into one ampère of current; thus, a conductor having five convolutions and carrying a current of half an ampère is said to have 21/2 ampère turns. The magnetizing effect of a coil is proportional to the number of its ampère turns

amperemeter.definition: An instrument for measuring the strength of an electrical current in ampères

ampersand.definition: A word used to describe the character &unr_;, &unr_;, or &

amphi-.definition: A prefix in words of Greek origin, signifying both, of both kinds, on both sides, about, around

amphiarthrosis.definition: A form of articulation in which the bones are connected by intervening substance admitting slight motion; symphysis

amphiaster.definition: The achromatic figure, formed in mitotic cell-division, consisting of two asters connected by a spindle-shaped bundle of rodlike fibers diverging from each aster, and called the spindle

amphibia.definition: One of the classes of vertebrates

amphibian.definition: Of or pertaining to the Amphibia; as, amphibian reptiles

amphibiology.definition: A treatise on amphibious animals; the department of natural history which treats of the Amphibia

amphibiotica.definition: A division of insects having aquatic larvæ

amphibious.definition: Having the ability to live both on land and in water, as frogs, crocodiles, beavers, and some plants

amphiblastic.definition: Segmenting unequally; -- said of telolecithal ova with complete segmentation

amphibole.definition: A common mineral embracing many varieties varying in color and in composition. It occurs in monoclinic crystals; also massive, generally with fibrous or columnar structure. The color varies from white to gray, green, brown, and black. It is a silicate of magnesium and calcium, with usually aluminium and iron. Some common varieties are tremolite, actinolite, asbestus, edenite, hornblende (the last name being also used as a general term for the whole species). Amphibole is a constituent of many crystalline rocks, as syenite, diorite, most varieties of trachyte, etc. See Hornblende

amphibolic.definition: Of or pertaining to amphiboly; ambiguous; equivocal

amphibolite.definition: a metamorphic rock composed chiefly of amphibole and plagioclase

amphibology.definition: A phrase, discourse, or proposition, susceptible of two interpretations; and hence, of uncertain meaning. It differs from equivocation, which arises from the twofold sense of a single term

amphibrach.definition: A foot of three syllables, the middle one long, the first and last short (˘ -- ˘); as, hăbēr&ebreve_;. In modern prosody the accented syllable takes the place of the long and the unaccented of the short; as, pro-phet&bprime_;ic

amphicarpic.definition: Producing fruit of two kinds, either as to form or time of ripening

amphichroic.definition: Exhibiting or producing two colors, as substances which in the color test may change red litmus to blue and blue litmus to red

amphicoelian.definition: Having both ends concave; biconcave; -- said of vertebræ

amphicome.definition: A kind of figured stone, rugged and beset with eminences, anciently used in divination

amphictyonic.definition: Of or pertaining to the Amphictyons or their League or Council; as, an Amphictyonic town or state; the Amphictyonic body

amphictyons.definition: Deputies from the confederated states of ancient Greece to a congress or council. They considered both political and religious matters

amphictyony.definition: A league of states of ancient Greece; esp. the celebrated confederation known as the Amphictyonic Council. Its object was to maintain the common interests of Greece

amphid.definition: A salt of the class formed by the combination of an acid and a base, or by the union of two oxides, two sulphides, selenides, or tellurides, as distinguished from a haloid compound

amphidisc.definition: A peculiar small siliceous spicule having a denticulated wheel at each end; -- found in freshwater sponges

amphidromical.definition: Pertaining to an Attic festival at the naming of a child; -- so called because the friends of the parents carried the child around the hearth and then named it

amphigamous.definition: Having a structure entirely cellular, and no distinct sexual organs; -- a term applied by De Candolle to the lowest order of plants

amphigean.definition: Extending over all the zones, from the tropics to the polar zones inclusive

amphigen.definition: An element that in combination produces amphid salt; -- applied by Berzelius to oxygen, sulphur, selenium, and tellurium

amphigenous.definition: Increasing in size by growth on all sides, as the lichens

amphigonic.definition: Pertaining to amphigony; sexual; as, amphigonic propagation

amphigoric.definition: Nonsensical; absurd; pertaining to an amphigory

amphigory.definition: A nonsense verse; a rigmarole, with apparent meaning, which on further attention proves to be meaningless

amphimacer.definition: A foot of three syllables, the middle one short and the others long, as in cāst&ibreve_;tās

amphineura.definition: A division of Mollusca remarkable for the bilateral symmetry of the organs and the arrangement of the nerves

amphioxus.definition: A fishlike creature (Amphioxus lanceolatus), two or three inches long, found in temperature seas; -- also called the lancelet. Its body is pointed at both ends. It is the lowest and most generalized of the vertebrates, having neither brain, skull, vertebræ, nor red blood. It forms the type of the group Acrania, Leptocardia, etc

amphipneust.definition: One of a tribe of Amphibia, which have both lungs and gills at the same time, as the proteus and siren

amphipoda.definition: A numerous group of fourteen -- footed Crustacea, inhabiting both fresh and salt water. The body is usually compressed laterally, and the anterior pairs or legs are directed downward and forward, but the posterior legs are usually turned upward and backward. The beach flea is an example. See Tetradecapoda and Arthrostraca

amphipodous.definition: Of or pertaining to the Amphipoda

amphiprostylar.definition: having columns at both ends but not on the sides

amphiprostyle.definition: Doubly prostyle; having columns at each end, but not at the sides

amphirhina.definition: A name applied to the elasmobranch fishes, because the nasal sac is double

amphisbaena.definition: A fabled serpent with a head at each end, moving either way

amphisbaenoid.definition: Like or pertaining to the lizards of the genus Amphisbæna

amphiscii.definition: The inhabitants of the tropic, whose shadows in one part of the year are cast to the north, and in the other to the south, according as the sun is south or north of their zenith

amphistomous.definition: Having a sucker at each extremity, as certain entozoa, by means of which they adhere

amphistylic.definition: Having the mandibular arch articulated with the hyoid arch and the cranium, as in the cestraciont sharks; -- said of a skull

amphitheater.definition: An oval or circular building with rising tiers of seats about an open space called the arena

amphitheatric.definition: Of, pertaining to, exhibited in, or resembling, an amphitheater

amphitheatrically.definition: In the form or manner of an amphitheater

amphitrocha.definition: A kind of annelid larva having both a dorsal and a ventral circle of special cilia

amphitropal.definition: Having the ovule inverted, but with the attachment near the middle of one side; half anatropous

amphiuma.definition: A genus of amphibians, inhabiting the Southern United States, having a serpentlike form, but with four minute limbs and two persistent gill openings; the Congo snake

amphopeptone.definition: A product of gastric digestion, a mixture of hemipeptone and antipeptone

amphora.definition: Among the ancients, a two-handled vessel, tapering at the bottom, used for holding wine, oil, etc

amphoral.definition: Pertaining to, or resembling, an amphora

amphoric.definition: Resembling a sound like that produced by blowing into an empty bottle; especially, a respiratory sound heard over cavities in the lungs during percussion and auscultation; as, amphoric respiration or resonance

amphoteric.definition: Partly one and partly the other

amphotericin.definition: an antibiotic and antifungal agent (C47H73NO17), produced by a strain of Streptomyces nodosus.  It is one of a class of polyene macrolide antibiotics effective against fungal infections.  It has a molecular weight of 924.11; it is soluble in oganic solvents but only slightly soluble in water

ampicillin.definition: a semisynthetic penicillin which can be considered as the common benzylpenicillin containing an amino group at the alpha benzyl position

ample.definition: Large; great in size, extent, capacity, or bulk; spacious; roomy; widely extended

amplectant.definition: Clasping a support; as, amplectant tendrils

ampleness.definition: The state or quality of being ample; largeness; fullness; completeness

amplexicaul.definition: Clasping or embracing a stem, as the base of some leaves

ampliative.definition: Enlarging a conception by adding to that which is already known or received

amplification.definition: The act of amplifying or enlarging in dimensions; enlargement; extension

amplificatory.definition: Serving to amplify or enlarge; amplificative

amplifier.definition: One who or that which amplifies

amplify.definition: To render larger, more extended, or more intense, and the like; -- used especially of telescopes, microscopes, etc

amplitude.definition: State of being ample; extent of surface or space; largeness of dimensions; size

ampule.definition: a small glass bottle which has been or can be sealed hermetically by application of flame to a narrow opening at the top

ampulla.definition: A narrow-necked vessel having two handles and bellying out like a jug

ampullaceous.definition: Like a bottle or inflated bladder; bottle-shaped; swelling

amputate.definition: To prune or lop off, as branches or tendrils

amputation.definition: The act of amputating; esp. the operation of cutting off a limb or projecting part of the body

ampyx.definition: A woman's headband (sometimes of metal), for binding the front hair

amrita.definition: Immortality; also, the nectar conferring immortality

amsonia.definition: a genus of herbs and subshrubs with milky juice and showy bluish flowers; native from Europe to Asia Minor to Japan and North America

amsterdam.definition: A large city which is an industrial center and the official capital of The Netherlands.    Population (2000) = 724,096

amt.definition: An administrative territorial division in Denmark and Norway

amuck.definition: In a frenzied and reckless manner

amulet.definition: An ornament, gem, or scroll, or a package containing a relic, etc., worn as a charm or preservative against evils or mischief, such as diseases and witchcraft, and generally inscribed with mystic forms or characters. [Also used figuratively.]

amuletic.definition: Of or pertaining to an amulet; operating as a charm

amuse.definition: To occupy or engage the attention of; to lose in deep thought; to absorb; also, to distract; to bewilder

amusette.definition: A light field cannon, or stocked gun mounted on a swivel

amusing.definition: Giving amusement; diverting; as, an amusing story

amusive.definition: Having power to amuse or entertain the mind; fitted to excite mirth

amvis.definition: An explosive consisting of ammonium nitrate, a derivative of nitrobenzene, chlorated napthalene, and wood meal

amyelous.definition: Characterized by lack of the spinal cord

amygdalaceous.definition: Akin to, or derived from, the almond

amygdalate.definition: Pertaining to, resembling, or made of, almonds

amygdalic.definition: Of or pertaining to almonds; derived from amygdalin; as, amygdalic acid

amygdalic acid.definition: An organic acid (C6H5.CH(OH).COOH) extracted from bitter almonds; called also mandelic acid and α-Hydroxybenzeneacetic acid

amygdalin.definition: A glucoside extracted from bitter almonds as a white, crystalline substance

amygdaline.definition: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, almonds

amygdaloid.definition: A variety of trap or basaltic rock, containing small cavities, occupied, wholly or in part, by nodules or geodes of different minerals, esp. agates, quartz, calcite, and the zeolites. When the imbedded minerals are detached or removed by decomposition, it is porous, like lava

amyl.definition: A univalent hydrocarbon radical, C5H11, of the paraffine series found in amyl alcohol or fusel oil, etc

amyl alcohol.definition: Any of eight isomeric liquid alcohols (C5H11.OH), transparent, colorless liquids. It is the hydroxide of amyl. Also called amylic alcohol.   The amyl alcohol obtained from fusel oil is mostly isoamyl alcohol  (3-methyl-1-butanol or 1-hydroxy-3-methylbutane), with some sec-amyl alcohol (2-methyl-1-butanol or 2-pentanol), and has a characteristic peculiar odor. Other than n-amyl alcohol (also called 1-pentanol) the other isomeric pentanols are not usually refered to as amyl alcohol.  The amyl alcohol mixture in fusel oil forms a colorless liquid with a peculiar cough-exciting odor and burning taste. It is used as a source of amyl compounds, such as amyl acetate, amyl nitrite, etc

amyl nitrite.definition: A yellowish oily volatile liquid, C5H11NO2, used in medicine as a heart stimulant and a vasodilator. The inhalation of its vapor instantly produces flushing of the face

amylaceous.definition: Pertaining to starch; of the nature of starch; starchy

amylate.definition: A compound of the radical amyl with oxygen and a positive atom or radical

amylene.definition: One of a group of metameric hydrocarbons, C5H10, of the ethylene series. The colorless, volatile, mobile liquid commonly called amylene is a mixture of different members of the group

amylic.definition: Pertaining to, or derived from, amyl; as, amylic ether

amylobacter.definition: A microörganism (Bacillus amylobacter) which develops in vegetable tissue during putrefaction

amylogen.definition: That part of the starch granule or granulose which is soluble in water

amyloidosis.definition: A disorder characterized by deposit of extracellular amyloid{2} in organs or tissues in an amount that interferes with normal function of the affected organ; it is often secondary to chronic rheumatoid arthritis or tuberculosis or multiple myeloma.   Called also amyloid degeneration waxy degeneration and lardaceous degeneration

amylolysis.definition: The conversion of starch into soluble products, as dextrins and sugar, esp. by the action of enzymes

amylolytic.definition: Effecting the conversion of starch into soluble dextrin and sugar; as, an amylolytic ferment

amylometer.definition: Instrument for determining the amount of starch in a substance

amylopsin.definition: The diastase of the pancreatic juice

amylose.definition: One of the starch group (C6H10O5)n of the carbohydrates; as, starch, arabin, dextrin, cellulose, etc

amyous.definition: Characterized by lack of muscular tissue

an.definition: This word is properly an adjective, but is commonly called the indefinite article. It is used before nouns of the singular number only, and signifies one, or any, but somewhat less emphatically. In such expressions as  “twice an hour,” “once an age,” a shilling an ounce  (see 2d A, 2), it has a distributive force, and is equivalent to each, every

an 't.definition: An it, that is, and it or if it. See An, conj

an't.definition: A contraction for are and am not; also used for is not; -- now usually written ain't

ana.definition: Of each; an equal quantity; as, wine and honey, ana (or, contracted, aa) two ounces, &ounce_; ij., that is, of wine and honey, each, two ounces

ana-.definition: A prefix in words from the Greek, denoting up, upward, throughout, backward, back, again, anew

anabaptist.definition: A name sometimes applied to a member of any sect holding that rebaptism is necessary for those baptized in infancy

anabaptistic.definition: Relating or attributed to the Anabaptists, or their doctrines

anabaptistry.definition: The doctrine, system, or practice, of Anabaptists

anabaptize.definition: To rebaptize; to rechristen; also, to rename

anabas.definition: A genus of fishes, remarkable for their power of living long out of water, and of making their way on land for considerable distances, and for climbing trees; the climbing fishes

anabasis.definition: A journey or expedition up from the coast, like that of the younger Cyrus into Central Asia, described by Xenophon in his work called “The Anabasis.”

anabatic.definition: Pertaining to anabasis; as, an anabatic fever

anabiosis.definition: suspended animation in organisms during periods of extreme drought from which they revive when moisture returns

anabolic.definition: Pertaining to anabolism; an anabolic changes, or processes, more or less constructive in their nature

anabolic steroid.definition: any of a variety of synthetic derivatives or analogs of testosterone, which promote the increase of muscle mass and strength.  The anabolic steroids are sometimes used by athletes to increase muscular strength so as to enhance their performance in competition.  They have serious side effects, and the use of such compounds has been banned by many athletic regulatory committees

anabolism.definition: The constructive metabolism of the body, as distinguished from catabolism

anabranch.definition: A branch of a river that reënters, or anastomoses with, the main stream; also, less properly, a branch which loses itself in sandy soil

anacamptic.definition: Reflecting of reflected; as, an anacamptic sound (and echo)

anacamptically.definition: By reflection; as, echoes are sound produced anacamptically

anacamptics.definition: The science of reflected light, now called catoptrics

anacanthini.definition: A group of teleostean fishes destitute of spiny fin-rays, as the cod

anacardiaceous.definition: Belonging to, or resembling, a family, or order, of plants of which the cashew tree is the type, and the species of sumac are well known examples

anacardic.definition: Pertaining to, or derived from, the cashew nut; as, anacardic acid

anacardium.definition: A genus of plants including the cashew tree. See Cashew

anacharis.definition: A fresh-water weed of the frog's-bit family (Hydrocharidaceae), native to America.  Transferred to England it became an obstruction to navigation.  Called also waterweed and water thyme

anachorism.definition: An error in regard to the place of an event or a thing; a referring something to a wrong place

anachronic.definition: Characterized by, or involving, anachronism; anachronistic

anachronism.definition: A misplacing or error in the order of time; an error in chronology by which events are misplaced in regard to each other, esp. one by which an event is placed too early; falsification of chronological relation

anachronistic.definition: Erroneous in date; containing an anachronism

anachronize.definition: To refer to, or put into, a wrong time

anaclastic.definition: Produced by the refraction of light, as seen through water; as, anaclastic curves

anaclastics.definition: That part of optics which treats of the refraction of light; -- commonly called dioptrics

anacoenosis.definition: A figure by which a speaker appeals to his hearers or opponents for their opinion on the point in debate

anacoluthia.definition: an abrupt change within a sentence from one syntactic structure to another

anacoluthon.definition: A lack of grammatical sequence or coherence in a sentence; an instance of a change of construction in a sentence so that the latter part does not syntactically correspond with the first part

anaconda.definition: A large South American snake of the Boa family (Eunectes murinus), which lives near rivers, and preys on birds and small mammals. The name is also applied to a similar large serpent (Python tigris) of Ceylon

anacreontic.definition: Pertaining to, after the manner of, or in the meter of, the Greek poet Anacreon; amatory and convivial

anacrotism.definition: A secondary notch in the pulse curve, obtained in a sphygmographic tracing

anacrusis.definition: A prefix of one or two unaccented syllables to a verse properly beginning with an accented syllable

anadem.definition: A garland or fillet; a chaplet or wreath

anadiplosis.definition: A repetition of the last word or any prominent word in a sentence or clause, at the beginning of the next, with an adjunct idea; as, “He retained his virtues amidst all his misfortunes -- misfortunes which no prudence could foresee or prevent.”

anadrom.definition: A fish that leaves the sea and ascends rivers

anadromous.definition: Ascending rivers from the sea, at certain seasons, for breeding, as the salmon, shad, etc

anaerobia.definition: Anaërobic bacteria. They are called facultative anaërobes when able to live either in the presence or absence of free oxygen; obligate anaërobes, or obligatory anaërobes, when they thrive only in its absence

anaerobic.definition: Not requiring air or oxygen for life; -- applied especially to those microbes to which free oxygen is unnecessary; anaërobiotic; -- opposed to aërobic

anaerobies.definition: Microörganisms which do not require oxygen, but are killed by it.  See obligate anaerobes under anaerobes

anaerobiotic.definition: Related to, or of the nature of, anaërobies

anaesthetization.definition: The process of anæsthetizing; also, the condition of the nervous system induced by anæsthetics

anaesthetized.definition: rendered insensible by means of anesthesia

anagallis.definition: a genus of chiefly Old World herbs

anagasta.definition: a genus of moths whose larvae are flour moths

anaglyph.definition: Any sculptured, chased, or embossed ornament worked in low relief, as a cameo

anaglyphic.definition: Pertaining to the art of chasing or embossing in relief; anaglyptic; -- opposed to diaglyptic or sunk work

anaglyptic.definition: Relating to the art of carving, enchasing, or embossing in low relief

anaglyptics.definition: The art of carving in low relief, embossing, etc

anaglyptograph.definition: An instrument by which a correct engraving of any embossed object, such as a medal or cameo, can be executed

anaglyptographic.definition: Of or pertaining to anaglyptography; as, anaglyptographic engraving

anaglyptography.definition: The art of copying works in relief, or of engraving as to give the subject an embossed or raised appearance; -- used in representing coins, bas-reliefs, etc

anagoge.definition: An elevation of mind to things celestial

anagogic.definition: Mystical; having a secondary spiritual meaning; as, the rest of the Sabbath, in an anagogical sense, signifies the repose of the saints in heaven; an anagogical explication

anagogics.definition: Mystical interpretations or studies, esp. of the Scriptures

anagram.definition: Literally, the letters of a word read backwards, but in its usual wider sense, the change of one word or phrase into another by the transposition of its letters.  Thus Galenus becomes angelus; William Noy (attorney-general to Charles I., and a laborious man) may be turned into I moyl in law

anagrammatic.definition: Pertaining to, containing, or making, an anagram

anagrammatism.definition: The act or practice of making anagrams

anagrammatize.definition: To transpose, as the letters of a word, so as to form an anagram

anakim.definition: A race of giants living in Palestine

anal.definition: Pertaining to, or situated near, the anus; as, the anal fin or glands

analcime.definition: A white or flesh-red mineral, of the zeolite family, occurring in isometric crystals. By friction, it acquires a weak electricity; hence its name

analectic.definition: Relating to analects; made up of selections; as, an analectic magazine

analemma.definition: An orthographic projection of the sphere on the plane of the meridian, the eye being supposed at an infinite distance, and in the east or west point of the horizon

analgen.definition: A crystalline compound used as an antipyretic and analgesic, employed chiefly in rheumatism and neuralgia. It is a complex derivative of quinoline

analgesic.definition: Serving to reduce the sensibility to pain without loss of consciousness

anallagmatic.definition: Not changed in form by inversion

anallantoic.definition: Without, or not developing, an allantois

anallantoidea.definition: The division of Vertebrata in which no allantois is developed. It includes amphibians, fishes, and lower forms

analog computer.definition: a computer that represents information by continuously variable quantities (e.g., positions or voltages)

analogical.definition: Founded on, or of the nature of, analogy; expressing or implying analogy

analogically.definition: In an analogical sense; in accordance with analogy; by way of similitude

analogism.definition: an argument from the cause to the effect; an a priori argument

analogist.definition: One who reasons from analogy, or represent, by analogy

analogize.definition: To employ, or reason by, analogy

analogous.definition: Having analogy; corresponding to something else; bearing some resemblance or proportion; -- often followed by to

analogue.definition: That which is analogous to, or corresponds with, some other thing

analogy.definition: A resemblance of relations; an agreement or likeness between things in some circumstances or effects, when the things are otherwise entirely different. Thus, learning enlightens the mind, because it is to the mind what light is to the eye, enabling it to discover things before hidden

analysis.definition: A resolution of anything, whether an object of the senses or of the intellect, into its constituent or original elements; an examination of the component parts of a subject, each separately, as the words which compose a sentence, the tones of a tune, or the simple propositions which enter into an argument. It is opposed to synthesis

analysis of variance.definition: a statistical technique by which the results of an observation or experiment are analyzed to determine the relative contributions of the different possible causative factors or variables to the outcome.  Abbreviated ANOVA

analyst.definition: One who analyzes; formerly, one skilled in algebraical geometry; now commonly, one skilled in chemical analysis

analytic.definition: Of or pertaining to analysis; resolving into elements or constituent parts; as, an analytical experiment; -- opposed to synthetic

analyzation.definition: The act of analyzing, or separating into constituent parts; analysis

analyze.definition: To subject to analysis; to resolve (anything complex) into its elements; to separate into the constituent parts, for the purpose of an examination of each separately; to examine in such a manner as to ascertain the elements or nature of the thing examined; to consider in detail in order to discover essential features or meaning; as, to analyze an action to ascertain its morality; to analyse a sonnet by Shakespeare; to analyse the evidence in a criminal trial; to analyse your real motives

analyzer.definition: One who, or that which, analyzes

anamese.definition: Of or pertaining to Anam, to southeastern Asia

anamnestic.definition: Aiding the memory; as, anamnestic remedies

anamniotic.definition: Without, or not developing, an amnion

anamorphoscope.definition: An instrument for restoring a picture or image distorted by anamorphosis to its normal proportions. It usually consists of a cylindrical mirror

anamorphosis.definition: A distorted or monstrous projection or representation of an image on a plane or curved surface, which, when viewed from a certain point, or as reflected from a curved mirror or through a polyhedron, appears regular and in proportion; a deformation of an image

anan.definition: An expression equivalent to What did you say? Sir? Eh?

anandrous.definition: Destitute of stamens, as certain female flowers

anapest.definition: A metrical foot consisting of three syllables, the first two short, or unaccented, the last long, or accented (˘ ˘ -); the reverse of the dactyl. In Latin d&ebreve_;-&ibreve_;-tās, and in English in-ter-vene&bprime_;, are examples of anapests

anapestic.definition: Pertaining to an anapest; consisting of an anapests; as, an anapestic meter, foot, verse

anaphase.definition: the stage of meiosis or mitosis when chromosomes move toward opposite ends of the nuclear spindle

anaphor.definition: A word (such as a pronoun) used to avoid repetition; the referent of an anaphor is determined by its antecedent

anaphora.definition: A repetition of a word or of words at the beginning of two or more successive clauses

anaphoric.definition: Of or pertaining to anaphora; as, anaphoric reference

anaphylactic.definition: Of or pertaining to anaphylaxis; caused by anaphylaxis

anaphylactic shock.definition: Shock resulting from anaphylaxis{2}.  It is a severe form of physiological shock, often having a fatal outcome, and is caused by an extreme immunological reaction to antigens.  It is characterized by smooth muscle contraction and capillary dilation throughout the body, initiated by antibodies of the IgE class.  It is usually seen when an antigen to which a person has become hypersensitized is injected intravenously or subcutaneously.  It is also called generalyzed anaphylaxis or systemic anaphylaxis, and sometimes anaphylaxis

anaphylaxis.definition: Hypersensitivity (to a foreign antigen) resulting from prior contact with the same or a related substance

anaplasia.definition: loss of structural differentiation within a cell or group of cells often with increased capacity for multiplication, as in a malignant tumor

anaplasty.definition: The art of operation of restoring lost parts or the normal shape by the use of healthy tissue

anaplerosis.definition: A filling up; restoring a defective part; especially, promoting granulation of wounds or ulcers

anapophysis.definition: An accessory process in many lumbar vertebræ

anaptotic.definition: Having lost, or tending to lose, inflections by phonetic decay; as, anaptotic languages

anaptychus.definition: One of a pair of shelly plates found in some cephalopods, as the ammonites

anarch.definition: The author of anarchy; one who excites revolt

anarchic.definition: Pertaining to anarchy; without rule or government; in political confusion; tending to produce anarchy; as, anarchic despotism; anarchical opinions

anarchism.definition: The doctrine or practice of anarchists

anarchist.definition: An anarch; one who advocates anarchy of aims at the overthrow of civil government

anarchy.definition: Absence of government; the state of society where there is no law or supreme power; a state of lawlessness; political confusion

anarthropoda.definition: One of the divisions of Articulata in which there are no jointed legs, as the annelids; -- opposed to Arthropoda

anarthropodous.definition: Having no jointed legs; pertaining to Anarthropoda

anarthrous.definition: Used without the article; as, an anarthrous substantive

anas.definition: A genus of water fowls, of the order Anseres, including certain species of fresh-water ducks

anasa.definition: a genus comprising the squash bugs

anasarcous.definition: Belonging, or affected by, anasarca, or dropsy; dropsical

anaseismic.definition: Moving up and down; -- said of earthquake shocks

anastate.definition: One of a series of substances formed, in secreting cells, by constructive or anabolic processes, in the production of protoplasm; -- opposed to katastate

anastatic.definition: Pertaining to a process or a style of printing from characters in relief on zinc plates

anastatica.definition: a genus of plants consisting of a single species, rose of Jericho (also called resurrection plant)

anastigmat.definition: compound lens or lens system designed to be free of astigmatism and able to form approximately point images

anastigmatic.definition: Not astigmatic;  free of astigmatism; -- pertaining to a lens or lens system, and used especially of a lens system which consists of a converging lens and a diverging lens of equal and opposite astigmatism but different focal lengths, and sensibly free from astigmatism

anastomose.definition: To inosculate; to intercommunicate by anastomosis, as the arteries and veins

anastomosis.definition: The inosculation of vessels, or intercommunication between two or more vessels or nerves, as the cross communication between arteries or veins

anastrophe.definition: An inversion of the natural order of words; as, echoed the hills, for, the hills echoed

anathema.definition: A ban or curse pronounced with religious solemnity by ecclesiastical authority, and accompanied by excommunication. Hence: Denunciation of anything as accursed

anathematic.definition: Pertaining to, or having the nature of, an anathema

anathematization.definition: The act of anathematizing, or denouncing as accursed; imprecation

anathematize.definition: To pronounce an anathema against; to curse. Hence: To condemn publicly as something accursed

anatifa.definition: An animal of the barnacle tribe, of the genus Lepas, having a fleshy stem or peduncle; a goose barnacle. See Cirripedia

anatiferous.definition: Producing ducks; -- applied to Anatifæ, under the absurd notion of their turning into ducks or geese. See Barnacle

anatine.definition: Of or pertaining to the ducks; ducklike

anatomic.definition: Of or relating to anatomy or dissection; as, the anatomic art; anatomical observations

anatomically.definition: In an anatomical manner; by means of dissection

anatomism.definition: The application of the principles of anatomy, as in art

anatomist.definition: One who is skilled in the art of anatomy, or dissection

anatomize.definition: To dissect; to cut in pieces, as an animal vegetable body, for the purpose of displaying or examining the structure and use of the several parts

anatomy.definition: The art of dissecting, or artificially separating the different parts of any organized body, to discover their situation, structure, and economy; dissection

anatreptic.definition: Overthrowing; defeating; -- applied to Plato's refutative dialogues

anatropal.definition: Having the ovule inverted at an early period in its development, so that the chalaza is as the apparent apex; -- opposed to orthotropous

anbury.definition: A soft tumor or bloody wart on horses or oxen

ancestor.definition: One from whom a person is descended, whether on the father's or mother's side, at any distance of time; a progenitor; a fore father

ancestral.definition: Of, pertaining to, derived from, or possessed by, an ancestor or ancestors; as, an ancestral estate

ancestry.definition: Condition as to ancestors; ancestral lineage; hence, birth or honorable descent

anchor.definition: A iron instrument which is attached to a ship by a cable (rope or chain), and which, being cast overboard, lays hold of the earth by a fluke or hook and thus retains the ship in a particular station

anchor light.definition: The lantern shown at night by a vessel at anchor. International rules of the road require vessels at anchor to carry from sunset to sunrise a single white light forward if under 150 feet in length, and if longer, two such lights, one near the stern and one forward

anchor shot.definition: A shot made with the object balls in an anchor space

anchor space.definition: In the balk-line game, any of eight spaces, 7 inches by 31/2, lying along a cushion and bisected transversely by a balk line. Object balls in an anchor space are treated as in balk

anchor watch.definition: A detail of one or more men who keep watch on deck at night when a vessel is at anchor

anchor-hold.definition: The hold or grip of an anchor, or that to which it holds

anchorage.definition: The act of anchoring, or the condition of lying at anchor

anchored.definition: Held by an anchor; at anchor; held safely; as, an anchored bark; also, shaped like an anchor; forked; as, an anchored tongue

anchoret.definition: One who renounces the world and secludes himself, usually for religious reasons; a hermit; a recluse

anchoretic.definition: Pertaining to an anchoret or hermit; after the manner of an anchoret

anchoretism.definition: The practice or mode of life of an anchoret

anchorless.definition: Without an anchor or stay. Hence: Drifting; unsettled

anchorman.definition: a woman television reporter who coordinates a broadcast to which several correspondents contribute.  Male correlate of anchorwoman

anchorperson.definition: an anchorman or anchorwoman..  The anchorperson usually begins the broadcast, discusses certain topics, and introduces new topics, which may be discussed by other reprorters, especially when the report is recorded or broadcast from a location other than the main broadcast studio

anchorwoman.definition: a woman television reporter who coordinates a broadcast to which several correspondents contribute.  Female correlate of anchorman

anchovy.definition: A small fish, about three inches in length, of the Herring family (Engraulis encrasicholus), caught in vast numbers in the Mediterranean, and pickled for exportation. The name is also applied to several allied species

anchovy pear.definition: A West Indian fruit like the mango in taste, sometimes pickled; also, the tree (Grias cauliflora) bearing this fruit

anchusa.definition: any of various Old World herbs of the genus Anchusa having one-sided clusters of trumpet-shaped flowers

anchusin.definition: A resinoid coloring matter obtained from alkanet root

anchylose.definition: To affect or be affected with anchylosis; to unite or consolidate so as to make a stiff joint; to grow together into one

ancient.definition: Old; that happened or existed in former times, usually at a great distance of time; belonging to times long past; specifically applied to the times before the fall of the Roman empire; -- opposed to modern; as, ancient authors, literature, history; ancient days

ancientness.definition: The quality of being ancient; antiquity; existence from old times

ancile.definition: The sacred shield of the Romans, said to have-fallen from heaven in the reign of Numa. It was the palladium of Rome

ancillary.definition: Subservient or subordinate, like a handmaid; auxiliary

ancillary administration.definition: An administration subordinate to, and in aid of, the primary or principal administration of an estate

ancipital.definition: Two-edged instead of round; -- said of certain flattened stems, as those of blue grass, and rarely also of leaves

ancome.definition: A small ulcerous swelling, coming suddenly; also, a whitlow

anconal.definition: Of or pertaining to the ancon or elbow

anconeus.definition: A muscle of the elbow and forearm

ancony.definition: A piece of malleable iron, wrought into the shape of a bar in the middle, but unwrought at the ends

ancylostomiasis.definition: A disease caused by the hookworm parasites of the genus Ancylostoma (especially Ancylostoma duodenale), and Necator americanus.  Typically, infection in humans occurs in the small intestine.  In the small intestine they suck the blood from the wall and, when present in large numbers, produce a severe anaemia.  Called also miner's anaemia, tunnel disease, brickmaker's anaemia, Egyptian chlorosis

and.definition: A particle which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence

andalusite.definition: A silicate of aluminium, occurring usually in thick rhombic prisms, nearly square, of a grayish or pale reddish tint. It was first discovered in Andalusia, Spain

andante.definition: Moving moderately slow, but distinct and flowing; quicker than larghetto, and slower than allegretto

andantino.definition: Rather quicker than andante; between that allegretto

andesine.definition: A kind of triclinic feldspar found in the Andes

andesite.definition: An eruptive rock allied to trachyte, consisting essentially of a triclinic feldspar, with pyroxene, hornblende, or hypersthene

andira.definition: small genus of evergreen trees of tropical America and West Africa

andiron.definition: A utensil for supporting wood when burning in a fireplace, one being placed on each side; a firedog; as, a pair of andirons

andorra la vella.definition: The capital city of Andorra.  Population (2000) = 22,390

andranatomy.definition: The dissection of a human body, especially of a male; androtomy

andreaea.definition: a genus of brown or blackish Alpine mosses having a dehiscent capsule with 4 longitudinal slits

andreaeales.definition: an order of mosses which comprises a single genus: Andreaea

andrena.definition: a bee that is a a member of the genus Andrena

andrenid.definition: a bee that is a a member of the genus Andrena

andrenidae.definition: a large family of solitary short-tongued bees most of which burrow in the ground

andrew.definition: one of the twelve apostles of Jesus; brother of Peter; patron saint of Scotland

andricus.definition: a genus of cynipid gall wasps, chiefly affecting oaks

androcephalous.definition: Having a human head (upon an animal's body), as the Egyptian sphinx

androdioecious.definition: Having perfect and staminate flowers on different plants

androecium.definition: The stamens of a flower taken collectively

androgen.definition: a hormone, such as testosterone or androsterone, that promotes development and maintenance of typical male sexual characteristics.  They are mostly produced in the testes

androgenic.definition: of or pertaining to androgens; having physiological effects like that of an androgen

androgynous.definition: Uniting both sexes in one, or having the characteristics of both; being in nature both male and female; hermaphroditic

androgyny.definition: Union of both sexes in one individual; hermaphroditism

android.definition: A machine or automaton in the form of a human being

andromeda.definition: A northern constellation, supposed to represent the mythical Andromeda

andromede.definition: A meteor appearing to radiate from a point in the constellation Andromeda, -- whence the name

andron.definition: The apartment appropriated for the males. This was in the lower part of the house

andropetalous.definition: Produced by the conversion of the stamens into petals, as double flowers, like the garden ranunculus

androphore.definition: A support or column on which stamens are raised

andropogon.definition: A very large and important genus of grasses, found in nearly all parts of the world. It includes the lemon grass of Ceylon and the beard grass, or broom sedge, of the United States. The principal subgenus is Sorghum, including  Andropogon sorghum and Andropogon halepensis, from which have been derived the Chinese sugar cane, the Johnson grass, the Aleppo grass, the broom corn, and the durra, or Indian millet. Several East Indian species, as Andropogon nardus and Andropogon schœnanthus, yield fragrant oils, used in perfumery

androsphinx.definition: A man sphinx; a sphinx having the head of a man and the body of a lion

androspore.definition: A spore of some algæ, which has male functions

androtomous.definition: Having the filaments of the stamens divided into two parts

androtomy.definition: Dissection of the human body, as distinguished from zoötomy; anthropotomy

androus.definition: A terminal combining form: Having a stamen or stamens; staminate; as, monandrous, with one stamen; polyandrous, with many stamens

anecdotage.definition: Anecdotes collectively; a collection of anecdotes

anecdotal.definition: Pertaining to, or abounding with, anecdotes; as, anecdotal conversation

anecdotic.definition: Pertaining to, consisting of, or addicted to, anecdotes

anecdotist.definition: One who relates or collects anecdotes

anelectric.definition: Not becoming electrified by friction; -- opposed to idioelectric

anelectrode.definition: The positive pole of a voltaic battery

anelectrotonus.definition: The condition of decreased irritability of a nerve in the region of the positive electrode or anode on the passage of a current of electricity through it

anemia.definition: A morbid condition in which number of the red blood cells or concentration of hemoglobin decreases below that of normal

anemogram.definition: A record made by an anemograph

anemograph.definition: An instrument for measuring and recording the direction and force of the wind

anemographic.definition: Produced by an anemograph; of or pertaining to anemography

anemometer.definition: An instrument for measuring the force or velocity of the wind; a wind gauge

anemometry.definition: The act or process of ascertaining the force or velocity of the wind

anemone.definition: A genus of plants of the Ranunculus or Crowfoot family; windflower. Some of the species are cultivated in gardens

anemonella.definition: a genus consisting of one species: the rue anemone

anemonic.definition: An acrid, poisonous, crystallizable substance, obtained from, the anemone, or from anemonin

anemonin.definition: An acrid, poisonous, crystallizable substance, obtained from some species of anemone

anemophilous.definition: pollinated by the wind; -- of flowering plants; especially grasses etc

anemopsis.definition: a genus consisting of one species: the yerba mansa

anemorphilous.definition: Fertilized by the agency of the wind; -- said of plants in which the pollen is carried to the stigma by the wind; wind-Fertilized

anemoscope.definition: An instrument which shows the direction of the wind; a wind vane; a weathercock; -- usually applied to a contrivance consisting of a vane above, connected in the building with a dial or index with pointers to show the changes of the wind

anemosis.definition: A condition in the wood of some trees in which the rings are separated, as some suppose, by the action of high winds upon the trunk; wind shake

anenst.definition: Over against; as, he lives anent the church

anenterous.definition: Destitute of a stomach or an intestine

aneroid.definition: Containing no liquid; -- said of a kind of barometer

anesthetic.definition: Capable of causing anesthesia; as, anæsthetic agents

anesthetist.definition: A medical specialist who administers an anesthetic to a patient before the patient is treated

anesthetize.definition: To produce anesthesia by an anæsthetic

anesthetized.definition: rendered insensible by anesthetizing.  Same as anaesthetized

anesthyl.definition: A mixture of methyl chloride and ethyl chloride; it is used as a local anesthetic, by spraying onto the skin

anestrus.definition: A state or interval of sexual inactivity between two periods of estrus; -- applies to nonhuman mammals

anethol.definition: A substance obtained from the volatile oils of anise, fennel, etc., in the form of soft shining scales; -- called also anise camphor

anethum.definition: a genus of plants of the parsley family having aromatic seeds and finely divided leaves, including the dill Anethum graveolens

aneurismatic.definition: of or pertaining to an aneurysm

aneurysm.definition: A soft, usually pulsating, sac, containing blood or blood clot, arising from the abnormal dilation of the walls of an artery, vein or heart.  The more common spelling is aneurysm

anew.definition: Over again; another time; in a new form; afresh; as, to arm anew; to create anew

anfractuosity.definition: A state of being anfractuous, or full of windings and turnings; sinuosity

anfractuous.definition: Winding; full of windings and turnings; sinuous; tortuous; as, the anfractuous spires of a horn

angelet.definition: A small gold coin formerly current in England; a half angel

angelhood.definition: The state of being an angel; angelic nature

angelic.definition: Belonging to, or proceeding from, angels; resembling, characteristic of, or partaking of the nature of, an angel; heavenly; divine

angelica.definition: An aromatic umbelliferous plant (Archangelica officinalis or Angelica archangelica) the leaf stalks of which are sometimes candied and used in confectionery, and the roots and seeds as an aromatic tonic

angelicalness.definition: The quality of being angelic; excellence more than human

angelify.definition: To make like an angel; to angelize

angelize.definition: To raise to the state of an angel; to render angelic

angelology.definition: A discourse on angels, or a body of doctrines in regard to angels

angelophany.definition: The actual appearance of an angel to man

angelot.definition: A French gold coin of the reign of Louis XI., bearing the image of St. Michael; also, a piece coined at Paris by the English under Henry VI

angelus.definition: A form of devotion in which three Ave Marias are repeated.  It is said at morning, noon, and evening, at the sound of a bell

anger.definition: Trouble; vexation; also, physical pain or smart of a sore, etc

angevine.definition: Of or pertaining to Anjou in France

angienchyma.definition: Vascular tissue of plants, consisting of spiral vessels, dotted, barred, and pitted ducts, and laticiferous vessels

angina.definition: Any inflammatory affection of the throat, as the quinsy, malignant sore throat, croup, etc., especially such as tends to produce suffocation, choking, or shortness of breath

anginal.definition: Of or pertaining to angina or angina pectoris

anginose.definition: Pertaining to angina or angina pectoris; anginal

angio-.definition: A prefix, or combining form, in numerous compounds, usually relating to seed or blood vessels, or to something contained in, or covered by, a vessel

angiocarp.definition: tree bearing fruit enclosed in a shell or involucre or husk

angiocarpic.definition: of or pertaining to an angiocarp; angiocarpous

angiocarpous.definition: Having fruit inclosed within a covering that does not form a part of itself; as, the filbert covered by its husk, or the acorn seated in its cupule

angiogram.definition: An X-ray photograph produced by angiography

angiography.definition: A description of blood vessels and lymphatics

angiology.definition: That part of anatomy which treats of blood vessels and lymphatics

angioma.definition: A tumor composed chiefly of blood or lymph vessels

angiomonospermous.definition: Producing one seed only in a seed pod

angioneuropathy.definition: Neuropathy of the neurons innervating blood vessels. Called also Angioneurosis, Vasomotor neurosis, Vasoneurosis

angioneurosis.definition: Angioneuropathy{1}.  The term angioneuropathy is now used more frequently than angioneurosis

angiopathy.definition: Disease of the vessels, esp. the blood vessels

angiopteris.definition: a highly variable species (Angiopteris evecta) of very large primitive ferns of the Pacific tropical areas with high rainfall

angioscope.definition: An instrument for examining the capillary vessels of animals and plants

angiosperm.definition: A plant which has its seeds inclosed in a pericarp.  Contrasted with gymnosperm

angiospermous.definition: Having seeds inclosed in a pod or other pericarp

angiosporous.definition: Having spores contained in cells or thecæ, as in the case of some fungi

angiostomous.definition: With a narrow mouth, as the shell of certain gastropods

angiotomy.definition: Dissection of the blood vessels and lymphatics of the body

angle.definition: The inclosed space near the point where two lines meet; a corner; a nook

angle of entry.definition: The angle between the tangent to the advancing edge (of an aërocurve) and the line of motion; -- contrasted with angle of trail, which is the angle between the tangent to the following edge and the line of motion

angle of incidence.definition: The angle between the chord of an aërocurve and the relative direction of the undisturbed air current

angle-park.definition: to park (a road vehicle) at an angle to the curb; -- contrasted with parallel-park

angled.definition: Having an angle or angles; -- used in compounds; as, right-angled, many-angled, etc

angledozer.definition: a bulldozer with an angled moldboard to push earth to one side
