anglemeter.definition: An instrument to measure angles, esp. one used by geologists to measure the dip of strata

angles.definition: An ancient Low German tribe, that settled in Britain, which came to be called Engla-land (Angleland or England). The Angles probably came from the district of Angeln (now within the limits of Schleswig), and the country now Lower Hanover, etc

anglesite.definition: A native sulphate of lead. It occurs in white or yellowish transparent, prismatic crystals

angleworm.definition: A earthworm of the genus Lumbricus, frequently used by anglers for bait. See Earthworm

anglian.definition: Of or pertaining to the Angles

anglican.definition: English; of or pertaining to England or the English nation; especially, pertaining to, or connected with, the established church of England; as, the Anglican church, doctrine, orders, ritual, etc

anglicanism.definition: Strong partiality to the principles and rites of the Church of England

anglice.definition: In English; in the English manner; as, Livorno, Anglice Leghorn

anglicism.definition: An English idiom; a phrase or form language peculiar to the English

anglicity.definition: The state or quality of being English

anglicization.definition: The act of anglicizing, or making English in character

anglicize.definition: To make English; to English; to anglify; render conformable to the English idiom, or to English analogies

anglify.definition: To convert into English; to anglicize

angling.definition: The act of one who angles; the art of fishing with rod and line

anglo-.definition: A combining form meaning the same as English; or English and, or English conjoined with; as, Anglo-Turkish treaty, Anglo-German, Anglo-Irish

anglo-american.definition: Of or pertaining to the English and Americans, or to the descendants of Englishmen in America

anglo-catholic.definition: Of or pertaining to a church modeled on the English Reformation; Anglican; -- sometimes restricted to the ritualistic or High Church section of the Church of England

anglo-catholicism.definition: The belief of those in the Church of England who accept many doctrines and practices which they maintain were those of the primitive, or true, Catholic Church, of which they consider the Church of England to be the lineal descendant; a doctrine and practice within the Church of England emphasizing the Catholic tradition

anglo-french.definition: the French (Norman) language used in medieval England

anglo-indian.definition: relating to British India or the English in India, or to the English and East Indian peoples or languages

anglo-jewish.definition: of English-speaking jews and their culture

anglo-norman.definition: Of or pertaining to the English and Normans, or to the Normans who settled in England

anglo-saxon.definition: of or pertaining to the Anglo-Saxons or their language; as, Anglo-Saxon poetry; The Anglo-Saxon population of Scotland

anglo-saxondom.definition: The Anglo-Saxon domain (i. e., Great Britain and the United States, etc.); the Anglo-Saxon race

anglo-saxonism.definition: A characteristic of the Anglo-Saxon race; especially, a word or an idiom of the Anglo-Saxon tongue

anglomania.definition: A mania for, or an inordinate attachment to, English customs, institutions, etc

anglophile.definition: an admirer of England and things English

anglophilia.definition: exaggerated admiration for England and English customs

anglophobe.definition: a person who hates England and everything English

anglophobia.definition: Intense dread of, or aversion to, England or the English

angola.definition: A fabric made from the wool of the Angora goat

angola pea.definition: A tropical plant (Cajanus indicus) and its edible seed, a kind of pulse; -- so called from Angola in Western Africa. Called also pigeon pea and Congo pea

angolese.definition: A member of the Bantu tribes resident in Angola

angora.definition: A city of Asia Minor (or Anatolia) which has given its name to a goat, a cat, etc

angostura.definition: A bitter aromatic bark, obtained from a South American tree of the rue family (Galipea cusparia, or Galipea officinalis).  It is used used as a tonic, in medicines, liqueurs and bitters

angoumois moth.definition: A small moth (Gelechia cerealella) which is very destructive to wheat and other grain. The larva eats out the interior of the grain, leaving only the shell

angraecum.definition: a genus of tropical Old World epiphytic orchids with showy flowers sometimes grotesque

angrecum.definition: any of various spectacular orchids of the genus Angraecum having 2-ranked dark green leathery leaves and usually nocturnally scented white or ivory flowers

angrily.definition: In an angry manner; under the influence of anger

angriness.definition: The quality of being angry, or of being inclined to anger

anguidae.definition: a family comprising the alligator lizards

anguilla.definition: a British colony, comprising an island in the Caribbean Sea, east of Puerto Rico, with a total area of 91 sq km.  Its population in 1996 was estimated at 10,424. The official language is English

anguillan.definition: a native or inhabitant of the island of Anguilla in the West Indies

anguillidae.definition: a natural family of eels that live in fresh water as adults but return to the sea to spawn

anguilliformes.definition: an order of elongate fishes with pelvic fins and girdle absent or reduced

anguine.definition: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, a snake or serpent

anguish.definition: Extreme pain, either of body or mind; excruciating distress

anguished.definition: suffering anguish; experiencing extreme pain, distress, or anxiety

angular.definition: Relating to an angle or to angles; having an angle or angles; forming an angle or corner; sharp-cornered; pointed; as, an angular figure

angularity.definition: The quality or state of being angular; angularness

angularly.definition: In an angular manner; with of at angles or corners

angulate.definition: Having angles or corners; angled; as, angulate leaves

angulometer.definition: An instrument for measuring external angles

angulosity.definition: A state of being angulous or angular

angustation.definition: The act of making narrow; a straitening or contacting

angusticlave.definition: A narrow stripe of purple worn by the equites on each side of the tunic as a sign of rank

angwantibo.definition: A small lemuroid mammal (Arctocebus Calabarensis) of Africa. It has only a rudimentary tail

anhelation.definition: Short and rapid breathing; a panting; asthma

anhele.definition: To pant; to be breathlessly anxious or eager (for)

anhima.definition: A South American aquatic bird; the horned screamer or kamichi (Palamedea cornuta). See Kamichi

anhimidae.definition: a family of aquatic birds of South America.  They are called screamers due to their harsh trumpeting call

anhinga.definition: An aquatic bird of the southern United States (Platus anhinga); the darter, or snakebird

anhistous.definition: Without definite structure; as, an anhistous membrane

anhydride.definition: An oxide of a nonmetallic body or an organic radical, capable of forming an acid by uniting with the elements of water; -- so called because it may be formed from an acid by the abstraction of water

anhydrite.definition: A mineral of a white or a slightly bluish color, usually massive. It is anhydrous sulphate of lime, and differs from gypsum in not containing water (whence the name)

anhydrous.definition: Destitute of water; as, anhydrous salts or acids

ani.definition: A black bird of tropical America, the West Indies and Florida (Crotophaga ani), allied to the cuckoos, having a compressed, bladelike bill and remarkable for communistic nesting

anicut.definition: A dam or mole made in the course of a stream for the purpose of regulating the flow of a system of irrigation

anient.definition: To frustrate; to bring to naught; to annihilate

anight.definition: In the night time; at night

anil.definition: A West Indian plant (Indigofera anil), one of the original sources of indigo; also, the indigo dye

anilic.definition: Pertaining to, or obtained from, anil; indigotic; -- applied to an acid formed by the action of nitric acid on indigo

anilide.definition: One of a class of compounds which may be regarded as amides in which more or less of the hydrogen has been replaced by phenyl

aniline.definition: An organic base belonging to the phenylamines. It may be regarded as ammonia in which one hydrogen atom has been replaced by the radical phenyl. It is a colorless, oily liquid, originally obtained from indigo by distillation, but now largely manufactured from coal tar or nitrobenzene as a base from which many brilliant dyes are made

anilism.definition: A disease caused by chronic exposure to aniline; aniline toxicity

anility.definition: The state of being an old woman; old-womanishness; dotage

animadversal.definition: The faculty of perceiving; a percipient

animadversion.definition: The act or power of perceiving or taking notice; direct or simple perception

animadversive.definition: Having the power of perceiving; percipient

animadvert.definition: To take notice; to observe; -- commonly followed by that

animadverter.definition: One who animadverts; a censurer; also [Obs.], a chastiser

animal.definition: An organized living being endowed with sensation and the power of voluntary motion, and also characterized by taking its food into an internal cavity or stomach for digestion; by giving carbonic acid to the air and taking oxygen in the process of respiration; and by increasing in motive power or active aggressive force with progress to maturity

animalcular.definition: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, animalcules

animalcule.definition: A small animal, as a fly, spider, etc

animalculism.definition: The theory which seeks to explain certain physiological and pathological phenomena by means of animalcules

animalculist.definition: One versed in the knowledge of animalcules

animalisation.definition: an act that makes people cruel or lacking normal human qualities

animalism.definition: The state, activity, or enjoyment of animals; mere animal life without intellectual or moral qualities or objectives; preoccupation with sensual, physical, or carnal pleasures

animalization.definition: The act of animalizing; the giving of animal life, or endowing with animal properties

animalize.definition: To endow with the properties of an animal; to represent in animal form

animastic.definition: Pertaining to mind or spirit; spiritual

animate.definition: To give natural life to; to make alive; to quicken; as, the soul animates the body

animated.definition: Endowed with life; full of life or spirit; indicating animation; lively; vigorous

animation.definition: The act of animating, or giving life or spirit; the state of being animate or alive

animative.definition: Having the power of giving life or spirit

animator.definition: One who, or that which, animates; an animater

anime.definition: Of a different tincture from the animal itself; -- said of the eyes of a rapacious animal

animism.definition: The doctrine, taught by Stahl, that the soul is the proper principle of life and development in the body

animist.definition: One who maintains the doctrine of animism

animose.definition: Full of spirit; hot; vehement; resolute

anion.definition: An electro-negative atom or group of atoms, or the element which, in electro-chemical decompositions, is evolved at the anode; -- opposed to cation

anionic.definition: having the character of an anion; negatively charged; containing anions; -- of atoms, molecules, and groups of atoms.  Contrasted with cationic

anise.definition: An umbelliferous plant (Pimpinella anisum) growing naturally in Egypt, and cultivated in Spain, Malta, etc., for its carminative and aromatic seeds

aniseed.definition: The seed of the anise; also, a cordial prepared from it

aniseikonia.definition: a visual defect in which the shape and size of an ocular image differ in the two eyes

anisette.definition: A French cordial or liqueur flavored with anise seeds

anisic.definition: Of or derived from anise; as, anisic acid; anisic alcohol

anisocoria.definition: Inequality of the pupils of the eyes

anisodactyla.definition: A group of herbivorous mammals characterized by having the hoofs in a single series around the foot, as the elephant, rhinoceros, etc

anisodactylous.definition: Characterized by unequal toes, three turned forward and one backward, as in most passerine birds

anisogamy.definition: reproduction by the union or fusion of two differing gametes (especially differing in size)

anisol.definition: Methyl phenyl ether, C6H5.O.CH3, got by distilling anisic acid or by the action of methide on potassium phenolate

anisomeric.definition: Not isomeric; not made of the same components in the same proportions

anisomerous.definition: Having the number of floral organs unequal, as four petals and six stamens

anisometric.definition: Not isometric; having unsymmetrical parts; -- said of crystals with three unequal axes

anisometropia.definition: Unequal refractive power in the two eyes

anisopleura.definition: A primary division of gastropods, including those having spiral shells. The two sides of the body are unequally developed

anisopoda.definition: A division of Crustacea, which, in some its characteristics, is intermediate between Amphipoda and Isopoda

anisospore.definition: A sexual spore in which the sexes differ in size; -- opposed to isospore

anisostemonous.definition: Having unequal stamens; having stamens different in number from the petals

anisotrope.definition: Not isotropic; having different properties in different directions; thus, crystals of the isometric system are optically isotropic, but all other crystals are anisotropic

anisyl.definition: The univalent radical, CH3.O.C6H4-, of which anisol is the hydride

anito.definition: In Guam and the Philippines, an idol, fetich, or spirit

ankara.definition: The capital city of Turkey.  Population (2000) = 2,890,025

anker.definition: A liquid measure in various countries of Europe. The Dutch anker, formerly also used in England, contained about 10 of the old wine gallons, or 81/2 imperial gallons

ankerite.definition: A mineral closely related to dolomite, but containing iron

ankh.definition: A tau cross with a loop at the top, used as an attribute or sacred emblem, symbolizing generation or enduring life. Called also crux ansata

ankle.definition: The joint which connects the foot with the leg; the tarsus

ankled.definition: Having ankles; -- used in composition; as, well-ankled

anklet.definition: An ornament or a fetter for the ankle; an ankle ring

anklets.definition: socks that reach just above the ankle

ankus.definition: An elephant goad with a sharp spike and hook, resembling a short-handled boat hook

ankylosis.definition: The process of formation of a stiff joint; also, the abnormal adhesion and rigidity of the bones of a joint which has become stiff

anlace.definition: A broad dagger formerly worn at the girdle

anlaut.definition: An initial sound, as of a word or syllable

ann.definition: A half years's stipend, over and above what is owing for the incumbency, due to a minister's heirs after his decease

anna.definition: An East Indian money of account, the sixteenth of a rupee, or about 2&unr_; cents

annalistic.definition: Pertaining to, or after the manner of, an annalist; as, the dry annalistic style

annals.definition: A relation of events in chronological order, each event being recorded under the year in which it happened

annapurna.definition: wife of Siva and a benevolent aspect of Devi: goddess of plenty

annats.definition: The first year's profits of a spiritual preferment, anciently paid by the clergy to the pope; first fruits. In England, they now form a fund for the augmentation of poor livings

anneal.definition: To subject to great heat, and then cool slowly, as glass, cast iron, steel, or other metal, for the purpose of rendering it less brittle; to temper; to toughen

annealer.definition: One who, or that which, anneals

annealing.definition: The process used to render glass, iron, etc., less brittle, performed by allowing them to cool very gradually from a high heat

annelid.definition: Of or pertaining to the Annelida

annelida.definition: A division of the Articulata, having the body formed of numerous rings or annular segments, and without jointed legs. The principal subdivisions are the Chætopoda, including the Oligochæta or earthworms and Polychæta or marine worms; and the Hirudinea or leeches. See Chætopoda

annelidous.definition: Of the nature of an annelid

annex.definition: To join or attach; usually to subjoin; to affix; to append; -- followed by to

annexation.definition: The act of annexing; process of attaching, adding, or appending; the act of connecting; union; as, the annexation of Texas to the United States, or of chattels to the freehold

annexment.definition: The act of annexing, or the thing annexed; appendage

annihilate.definition: To reduce to nothing or nonexistence; to destroy the existence of; to cause to cease to be

annihilating.definition: criticising vehemently and effectively; making light of; as, afire with annihilating invective

annihilation.definition: The act of reducing to nothing, or nonexistence; or the act of destroying the form or combination of parts under which a thing exists, so that the name can no longer be applied to it; as, the annihilation of a corporation

annihilationist.definition: One who believes that eternal punishment consists in annihilation or extinction of being; a destructionist

annihilator.definition: One who, or that which, annihilates; as, a fire annihilator

anniversary.definition: Returning with the year, at a stated time; annual; yearly; as, an anniversary feast

anno domini.definition: In the year of the Christian era; as, a. d. 1887

annodated.definition: Curved somewhat in the form of the letter S

annonaceae.definition: a family of chiefly tropical trees or shrubs

annotate.definition: To explain or criticize by notes; as, to annotate the works of Bacon

annotation.definition: A note, added by way of comment, or explanation; -- usually in the plural; as, annotations on ancient authors, or on a word or a passage

annotative.definition: Characterized by annotations; of the nature of annotation

annotator.definition: A writer of annotations; a commentator

annotatory.definition: Pertaining to an annotator; containing annotations

annotine.definition: A bird one year old, or that has once molted

annotinous.definition: A year old; in Yearly growths

annotto.definition: A red or yellowish-red dyeing material, prepared from the pulp surrounding the seeds of a tree (Bixa orellana) belonging to the tropical regions of America. It is used for coloring cheese, butter, etc

announce.definition: To give public notice, or first notice of; to make known; to publish; to proclaim

announced.definition: stated publicly; as, their announced intentions

announcement.definition: The act of announcing, or giving notice; that which announces; proclamation; publication

annoy.definition: To disturb or irritate, especially by continued or repeated acts; to tease; to ruffle in mind; to vex; as, I was annoyed by his remarks

annoyance.definition: The act of annoying, or the state of being annoyed; molestation; vexation; annoy

annoyed.definition: aroused to impatience or anger; as, feeling annoyed by the constant teasing

annoyer.definition: One who, or that which, annoys

annual.definition: Of or pertaining to a year; returning every year; coming or happening once in the year; yearly

annualist.definition: One who writes for, or who edits, an annual

annueler.definition: A priest employed in saying annuals, or anniversary Masses

annuent.definition: Nodding; as, annuent muscles (used in nodding)

annuitant.definition: One who receives, or its entitled to receive, an annuity

annuity.definition: A sum of money, payable yearly, to continue for a given number of years, for life, or forever; an annual allowance

annul.definition: To reduce to nothing; to obliterate

annular.definition: Pertaining to, or having the form of, a ring; forming a ring; ringed; ring-shaped; as, annular fibers

annularity.definition: Annular condition or form; as, the annularity of a nebula

annulary.definition: Having the form of a ring; annular

annulata.definition: A class of articulate animals, nearly equivalent to Annelida, including the marine annelids, earthworms, Gephyrea, Gymnotoma, leeches, etc. See Annelida

annulation.definition: A circular or ringlike formation; a ring or belt

annulment.definition: The act of annulling; abolition; invalidation

annuloid.definition: Of or pertaining to the Annuloida

annuloida.definition: A division of the Articulata, including the annelids and allied groups; sometimes made to include also the helminths and echinoderms

annulosa.definition: A division of the Invertebrata, nearly equivalent to the Articulata. It includes the Arthoropoda and Anarthropoda. By some Zoologists it is applied to the former only

annulose.definition: Furnished with, or composed of, rings or ringlike segments; ringed

annulus.definition: A ring; a ringlike part or space

annumerate.definition: To add on; to count in

annunciable.definition: That may be announced or declared; declarable

annunciation.definition: The act of announcing; announcement; proclamation; as, the annunciation of peace

annunciation lily.definition: The common white lily (Lilium candidum). So called because it is usually introduced by painters in pictures of the Annunciation

annunciator.definition: One who announces. Specifically: An officer in the church of Constantinople, whose business it was to inform the people of the festivals to be celebrated

annunciatory.definition: Pertaining to, or containing, announcement; making known

annwfn.definition: the other world; land of fairies

annwn.definition: the other world; land of fairies

anoa.definition: A small wild ox of Celebes (Anoa depressicornis), allied to the buffalo, but having long nearly straight horns

anobiidae.definition: the family comprising the deathwatch beetles

anodal.definition: of or at or relating to an anode.  Contrastive to cathodic

anode.definition: The positive pole of an electric battery, or more strictly the electrode by which the current enters the electrolyte on its way to the other pole; -- opposed to cathode

anodize.definition: to coat a metal with an oxide coat by electrolytic action at an anode; -- used especially to coat aluminum

anodon.definition: A genus of fresh-water bivalves, having no teeth at the hinge

anodonta.definition: a genus of thin-shelled freshwater mussels

anoint.definition: To smear or rub over with oil or an unctuous substance; also, to spread over, as oil

anointment.definition: The act of anointing, or state of being anointed; also, an ointment

anole.definition: A small arboreal tropical American insectivorous lizard (Anolis carolinensis) with the ability to change skin color

anolis.definition: A genus of lizards which belong to the family Iguanidæ. They take the place in the New World of the chameleons in the Old, and in America are often called chameleons

anomalism.definition: An anomaly; a deviation from rule

anomalistic.definition: Irregular; departing from common or established rules

anomalopidae.definition: a natural family comprising the flashlightfishes

anomalops.definition: a fish having a luminous organ beneath eye; it inhabits warm waters of the West Pacific and Puerto Rico.  It is called also flashlight fish

anomalopteryx.definition: the smallest moa (Anomalopteryx oweni); it is a slender moa about the size of a large turkey

anomalous.definition: Deviating from a general rule, method, or analogy; abnormal; irregular; as, an anomalous proceeding

anomaly.definition: Deviation from the common rule; an irregularity; anything anomalous

anomia.definition: A genus of bivalve shells, allied to the oyster, so called from their unequal valves, of which the lower is perforated for attachment

anomura.definition: A group of decapod Crustacea, of which the hermit crab in an example

anomural.definition: Irregular in the character of the tail or abdomen; as, the anomural crustaceans

anona.definition: A genus of tropical or subtropical plants of the natural order Anonaceæ, including the soursop

anonaceous.definition: Pertaining to the order of plants including the soursop, custard apple, etc

anonym.definition: One who is anonymous; also sometimes used for “pseudonym.”

anonymity.definition: The quality or state of being anonymous; anonymousness; also, that which anonymous

anonymous.definition: Nameless; of unknown name; also, of unknown or unavowed authorship; as, an anonymous benefactor; an anonymous pamphlet or letter

anonymously.definition: In an anonymous manner; without a name

anonymousness.definition: The state or quality of being anonymous

anopheles.definition: A genus of mosquitoes which are secondary hosts of the malaria parasites, and whose bite is the usual, if not the only, means of infecting human beings with malaria. Several species are found in the United States. They may be distinguished from the ordinary mosquitoes of the genus Culex by the long slender palpi, nearly equaling the beak in length, while those of the female Culex are very short. They also assume different positions when resting, Culex usually holding the body parallel to the surface on which it rests and keeping the head and beak bent at an angle, while Anopheles holds the body at an angle with the surface and the head and beak in line with it. Unless they become themselves infected by previously biting a subject affected with malaria, the insects cannot transmit the disease

anophyte.definition: A moss or mosslike plant which cellular stems, having usually an upward growth and distinct leaves

anopia.definition: Defect or absence of sight; blindness

anopla.definition: One of the two orders of Nemerteans. See Nemertina

anoplothere.definition: A genus of extinct quadrupeds of the order Ungulata, whose were first found in the gypsum quarries near Paris; characterized by the shortness and feebleness of their canine teeth (whence the name)

anoplura.definition: A group of insects which includes the lice

anorexigenic.definition: causing loss of appetite; as, an anorectic (or anorexigenic) drug

anorthic.definition: Having unequal oblique axes; as, anorthic crystals

anorthite.definition: A mineral of the feldspar family, commonly occurring in small glassy crystals, also a constituent of some igneous rocks. It is a lime feldspar. See Feldspar

anorthoclase.definition: A feldspar closely related to orthoclase, but triclinic. It is chiefly a silicate of sodium, potassium, and aluminium. Sp. gr., 2.57 -- 2.60

anorthopia.definition: Distorted vision, in which straight lines appear bent

anorthoscope.definition: An optical toy for producing amusing figures or pictures by means of two revolving disks, on one of which distorted figures are painted

anorthosite.definition: A granular igneous rock composed almost exclusively of a soda-lime feldspar, usually labradorite

anosmia.definition: Loss of the sense of smell

anostraca.definition: An order of small aquatic crustaceans lacking a carapace, including the fairy shrimps and the brine shrimps

another.definition: One more, in addition to a former number; a second or additional one, similar in likeness or in effect

anoxemia.definition: A former term used to refer to an abnormal condition due to deficient oxygenation of the arterial blood, as in balloon sickness, mountain sickness; now the term is replaced by the term hypoxemia

anoxia.definition: A physiological state in which insufficient oxygen reaches the tissues of the body, especially when of sufficient severity to cause permanent damage; severe hypoxia

anoxic.definition: Of, pertaining to, or suffering from, anoxia

ansa.definition: A name given to either of the projecting ends of Saturn's ring

anserated.definition: Having the extremities terminate in the heads of eagles, lions, etc.; as, an anserated cross

anseres.definition: A Linnæan order of aquatic birds swimming by means of webbed feet, as the duck, or of lobed feet, as the grebe. In this order were included the geese, ducks, auks, divers, gulls, petrels, etc

anseriformes.definition: A division of birds including the geese, ducks, and closely allied forms

anserinae.definition: a family name used in some classifications for the swans

anserine.definition: Pertaining to, or resembling, a goose, or the skin of a goose

answer.definition: To speak in defense against; to reply to in defense; as, to answer a charge; to answer an accusation

answerable.definition: Obliged to answer; liable to be called to account; liable to pay, indemnify, or make good; accountable; amenable; responsible; as, an agent is answerable to his principal; to be answerable for a debt, or for damages

answerableness.definition: The quality of being answerable, liable, responsible, or correspondent

answerably.definition: In an answerable manner; in due proportion or correspondence; suitably

answerless.definition: Having no answer, or impossible to be answered

ant.definition: A hymenopterous insect of the Linnæan genus Formica, which is now made a family of several genera; an emmet; a pismire

ant cow.definition: Any aphid from which ants obtain honeydew.  The plural form is ant cattle

ant egg.definition: One of the small white egg-shaped pupæ or cocoons of the ant, often seen in or about ant-hills, and popularly supposed to be eggs

ant thrush.definition: One of several species of tropical birds, of the Old World, of the genus Pitta, somewhat resembling the thrushes, and feeding chiefly on ants

ant-bear.definition: An edentate animal of tropical America (the Tamanoir), living on ants. It belongs to the genus Myrmecophaga

ant-cattle.definition: Various kinds of plant lice or aphids tended by ants for the sake of the honeydew which they secrete; plural of ant cow. See Aphips

ant-eater.definition: One of several species of edentates and monotremes that feed upon ants. See Ant-bear, Pangolin, Aard-vark, and Echidna

ant-hill.definition: A mound thrown up by ants or by termites in forming their nests

ant-lion.definition: A neuropterous insect, the larva of which makes in the sand a pitfall to capture ants, etc. The common American species is Myrmeleon obsoletus, the European is Myrmeleon formicarius

anta.definition: A species of pier produced by thickening a wall at its termination, treated architecturally as a pilaster, with capital and base

antacrid.definition: Corrective of acrimony of the humors

antaean.definition: Pertaining to Antaeus, a giant athlete slain by Hercules

antagonism.definition: Opposition of action; counteraction or contrariety of things or principles

antagonist.definition: One who contends with another, especially in combat; an adversary; an opponent

antagonistical.definition: Opposing in combat, combating; contending or acting against; as, antagonistic forces

antagonists.definition: muscles having opposite effects; the contraction of one neutralizes the contraction of the other

antagonize.definition: To contend with; to oppose actively; to counteract

antalkali.definition: Anything that neutralizes, or that counteracts an alkaline tendency in the system

antanaclasis.definition: A figure which consists in repeating the same word in a different sense; as, Learn some craft when young, that when old you may live without craft

antanagoge.definition: A figure which consists in answering the charge of an adversary, by a counter charge

antananarivo.definition: The capital city of Madagascar.  Population (2000) = 1,000,000

antaphrodisiac.definition: Capable of blunting the sexual appetite

antarctic.definition: Opposite to the northern or arctic pole; relating to the southern pole or to the region near it, and applied especially to a circle, distant from the pole 23° 28′. Thus we say the antarctic pole, circle, ocean, region, current, etc

antares.definition: The principal star in Scorpio: -- called also the Scorpion's Heart

antasthmatic.definition: Opposing, or fitted to relieve, asthma

ante.definition: Each player's stake, which is put into the pool before (ante) the game begins

ante mortem.definition: Before death; -- generally used adjectively; as, an ante-mortem statement; ante-mortem examination

ante-.definition: A Latin preposition and prefix; akin to Gr. 'anti`, Skr. anti, Goth. and-, anda- (only in comp.), AS. and-, ond-, (only in comp.: cf. Answer, Along), G. ant-, ent- (in comp.). The Latin ante is generally used in the sense of before, in regard to position, order, or time, and the Gr. 'anti` in that of opposite, or in the place of

antebellum.definition: belonging to a period before a war, especially the American Civil War

antecede.definition: To go before in time or place; to precede; to surpass

antecedence.definition: The act or state of going before in time; precedence

antecedency.definition: The state or condition of being antecedent; priority

antecedent.definition: Going before in time; prior; anterior; preceding; as, an event antecedent to the Deluge; an antecedent cause

antecedently.definition: Previously; before in time; at a time preceding; as, antecedently to conversion

antecessor.definition: One who goes before; a predecessor

antechamber.definition: A chamber or apartment before the chief apartment and leading into it, in which persons wait for audience; an outer chamber. See Lobby

antechapel.definition: The outer part of the west end of a collegiate or other chapel

antechoir.definition: A space inclosed or reserved at the entrance to the choir, for the clergy and choristers

antecommunion.definition: A name given to that part of the Anglican liturgy for the communion, which precedes the consecration of the elements

antedate.definition: Prior date; a date antecedent to another which is the actual date

antediluvial.definition: Before the flood, or Deluge, in Noah's time

antediluvian.definition: Of or relating to the period before the Deluge in Noah's time; hence, antiquated; as, an antediluvian vehicle

antedon.definition: A genus formerly called genus Comatula

antedonidae.definition: A natural family of feather stars; formerly called family Comatulidae

antefix.definition: An ornament fixed upon a frieze

anteflexion.definition: A displacement forward of an organ, esp. the uterus, in such manner that its axis is bent upon itself

antelope.definition: One of a group of ruminant quadrupeds, intermediate between the deer and the goat. The horns are usually annulated, or ringed. There are many species in Africa and Asia

antelucan.definition: Held or being before light; -- a word applied to assemblies of Christians, in ancient times of persecution, held before light in the morning

antemeridian.definition: Being before noon; in or pertaining to the forenoon. (Abbrev. a. m.)

antemosaic.definition: Being before the time of Moses

antemundane.definition: Being or occurring before the creation of the world

antemural.definition: An outwork of a strong, high wall, with turrets, in front of the gateway (as of an old castle), for defending the entrance

antenicene.definition: Of or in the Christian church or era, anterior to the first council of Nice, held a. d. 325; as, antenicene faith

antenna.definition: A movable, articulated organ of sensation, attached to the heads of insects and Crustacea. There are two in the former, and usually four in the latter. They are used as organs of touch, and in some species of Crustacea the cavity of the ear is situated near the basal joint. In insects, they are popularly called horns, and also feelers. The term in also applied to similar organs on the heads of other arthropods and of annelids

antennule.definition: A small antenna; -- applied to the smaller pair of antennæ or feelers of Crustacea

antenuptial.definition: Preceding marriage; as, an antenuptial agreement

antepaschal.definition: Pertaining to the time before the Passover, or before Easter

antependium.definition: The hangings or screen in front of the altar; an altar cloth; the frontal

antepenult.definition: The last syllable of a word except two, as -syl- in monosyllable

antepenultimate.definition: Of or pertaining to the last syllable but two

anteport.definition: An outer port, gate, or door

anteposition.definition: The placing of a before another, which, by ordinary rules, ought to follow it

antepredicament.definition: A prerequisite to a clear understanding of the predicaments and categories, such as definitions of common terms

anteriority.definition: The state of being anterior or preceding in time or in situation; priority

antero-.definition: A combining form meaning anterior, front; as, antero-posterior, front and back; antero-lateral, front side, anterior and at the side

anteroom.definition: A room before, or forming an entrance to, another; a waiting room

antestature.definition: A small intrenchment or work of palisades, or of sacks of earth

antestomach.definition: A cavity which leads into the stomach, as in birds

antetemple.definition: The portico, or narthex in an ancient temple or church

anteversion.definition: A displacement of an organ, esp. of the uterus, in such manner that its whole axis is directed further forward than usual

anthelion.definition: A halo opposite the sun, consisting of a colored ring or rings around the shadow of the spectator's own head, as projected on a cloud or on an opposite fog bank

anthelminthic.definition: capable of expelling or destroying parasitic worms

anthem.definition: Formerly, a hymn sung in alternate parts, in present usage, a selection from the Psalms, or other parts of the Scriptures or the liturgy, set to sacred music

anthemis.definition: Chamomile; a genus of composite, herbaceous plants

anther.definition: That part of the stamen containing the pollen, or fertilizing dust, which, when mature, is emitted for the impregnation of the ovary

antheraea.definition: a genus of large moths whose larvae produce silk of high quality

anthericum.definition: a genus of Old World (mainly African) perennial herbs; sometimes placed in family Asphodelaceae

antheridiophore.definition: a gametophore bearing antheridia as in certain mosses and liverworts

antheridium.definition: The male reproductive apparatus in the lower plants, consisting of a cell or other cavity in which spermatozoids are produced; -- called also spermary

antherogenous.definition: Transformed from anthers, as the petals of a double flower

antherozoid.definition: One of the mobile male reproductive bodies in the antheridia of cryptogams

anthesis.definition: The period or state of full expansion in a flower

anthobian.definition: A beetle which feeds on flowers

anthobranchia.definition: A division of nudibranchiate Mollusca, in which the gills form a wreath or cluster upon the posterior part of the back. See Nudibranchiata, and Doris

anthocarpous.definition: Having some portion of the floral envelopes attached to the pericarp to form the fruit, as in the checkerberry, the mulberry, and the pineapple

anthodium.definition: The inflorescence of a compound flower in which many florets are gathered into a involucrate head

anthokyan.definition: The blue coloring matter of certain flowers. Same as Cyanin

antholite.definition: A fossil plant, like a petrified flower

anthological.definition: Pertaining to anthology; consisting of beautiful extracts from different authors, especially the poets

anthophagous.definition: Eating flowers; -- said of certain insects

anthophilous.definition: Lit., fond of flowers; hence, feeding upon, or living among, flowers

anthophore.definition: The stipe when developed into an internode between calyx and corolla, as in the Pink family

anthophyllite.definition: A mineral of the hornblende group, of a yellowish gray or clove brown color

anthorism.definition: A description or definition contrary to that which is given by the adverse party

anthotaxy.definition: The arrangement of flowers in a cluster; the science of the relative position of flowers; inflorescence

anthozoa.definition: The class of the Cœlenterata which includes the corals and sea anemones. The three principal groups or orders are Acyonaria, Actinaria, and Madreporaria

anthozoic.definition: Of or pertaining to the Anthozoa

anthracene.definition: A solid hydrocarbon, C6H4.C2H2.C6H4, which accompanies naphthalene in the last stages of the distillation of coal tar. Its chief use is in the artificial production of alizarin

anthracene oil.definition: A heavy green oil (partially solidifying on cooling), which distills over from coal tar at a temperature above 270°. It is the principal source of anthracene

anthracic.definition: Of or relating to anthrax; as, anthracic blood

anthracite.definition: A hard, compact variety of mineral coal, of high luster, differing from bituminous coal in containing little or no bitumen, in consequence of which it burns with a nearly non luminous flame. The purer specimens consist almost wholly of carbon. Also called glance coal and blind coal

anthracitic.definition: Of, pertaining to, or like, anthracite; as, anthracitic formations

anthracnose.definition: Any one of several fungus diseases, caused by parasitic species of the series Melanconiales, attacking the bean, grape, melon, cotton, and other plants. In the case of the grape, brown concave spots are formed on the stem and fruit, and the disease is called bird's-eye rot

anthracoid.definition: Resembling anthrax in action; of the nature of anthrax; as, an anthracoid microbe

anthracomancy.definition: Divination by inspecting a burning coal

anthracometer.definition: An instrument for measuring the amount of carbonic acid in a mixture

anthracometric.definition: Of or pertaining to an anthracometer

anthraconite.definition: A coal-black marble, usually emitting a fetid smell when rubbed; -- called also stinkstone and swinestone

anthracosis.definition: A chronic lung disease, common among coal miners, due to the inhalation of coal dust; -- called also collier's lung and miner's phthisis.  See also the related conditions pneumomelanosis and pneumoconiosis (black lung)

anthraquinone.definition: A hydrocarbon, C6H4.C2O2.C6H4, subliming in shining yellow needles. It is obtained by oxidation of anthracene

anthrax vaccine.definition: A fluid vaccine obtained by growing a bacterium (Bacillus anthracis, formerly Bacterium anthracis) in beef broth. It is used to immunize animals, esp. cattle

anthrenus.definition: A genus of small beetles, several of which, in the larval state, are very destructive to woolen goods, fur, etc.  The common “museum pest” is Anthrenus varius; the carpet beetle is Anthrenus scrophulariæ. The larvæ are commonly confounded with moths

anthropic.definition: Like or related to man; human

anthropidae.definition: The group that includes man only

anthropocentric.definition: Assuming man as the center or ultimate end; -- applied to theories of the universe or of any part of it, as the solar system

anthropocentricity.definition: an inclination to evaluate reality exclusively in terms of human values

anthropocentrism.definition: an inclination to evaluate reality exclusively in terms of human values

anthropogenesis.definition: the evolution or genesis of the human race

anthropogenetic.definition: of or pertaining to anthropogenesis; caused by mankind or by humans

anthropogeny.definition: The science or study of human generation, or the origin and development of man

anthropogeography.definition: The science of the human species as to geographical distribution and environment. Broadly, it includes industrial, commercial, and political geography, and that part of ethnology which deals with distribution and physical environment

anthropoglot.definition: An animal which has a tongue resembling that of man, as the parrot

anthropography.definition: That branch of anthropology which treats of the actual distribution of the human race in its different divisions, as distinguished by physical character, language, institutions, and customs, in contradistinction to ethnography, which treats historically of the origin and filiation of races and nations

anthropoid.definition: Resembling man; -- applied especially to certain apes, as the ourang or gorilla

anthropoidea.definition: The suborder of primates which includes the monkeys, apes, and man

anthropolite.definition: A petrifaction of the human body, or of any portion of it

anthropologic.definition: Pertaining to anthropology; belonging to the nature of man

anthropologist.definition: One who is versed in anthropology

anthropology.definition: The science of the structure and functions of the human body

anthropomancy.definition: Divination by the entrails of human being

anthropometry.definition: Measurement of the height and other dimensions of human beings, especially at different ages, or in different races, occupations, etc

anthropomorphism.definition: The representation of the Deity, or of a polytheistic deity, under a human form, or with human attributes and affections

anthropomorphist.definition: One who attributes the human form or other human attributes to the Deity or to anything not human

anthropomorphite.definition: One who ascribes a human form or human attributes to the Deity or to a polytheistic deity

anthropomorphize.definition: To attribute a human form or personality to

anthropomorphology.definition: The application to God of terms descriptive of human beings

anthropomorphosis.definition: Transformation into the form of a human being

anthropomorphous.definition: Having the figure of, or resemblance to, a man; as, an anthropomorphous plant

anthroponomics.definition: The science of the laws of the development of the human organism in relation to other organisms and to environment

anthropopathism.definition: The ascription of human feelings or passions to God, or to a polytheistic deity

anthropopathite.definition: One who ascribes human feelings to deity

anthropophagy.definition: The eating of human flesh; cannibalism

anthroposcopy.definition: The art of discovering or judging of a man's character, passions. and inclinations from a study of his visible features

anthroposophy.definition: Knowledge of the nature of man; hence, human wisdom

anthropotomical.definition: Pertaining to anthropotomy, or the dissection of human bodies

anthropotomist.definition: One who is versed in anthropotomy, or human anatomy

anthropotomy.definition: The anatomy or dissection of the human body; androtomy

anti.definition: A prefix meaning against, opposite or opposed to, contrary, or in place of; -- used in composition in many English words. It is often shortened to ant-; as, antacid, antarctic

anti-abortionist.definition: a person who is opposed to legal voluntary abortion

anti-aircraft.definition: designed for or used for defense against attack by aircraft; as, anti-aircraft cannon

anti-american.definition: Opposed to the Americans, their aims, or interests, or to the genius of American institutions

anti-federalist.definition: One of party opposed to a federative government; -- applied particularly to the party which opposed the adoption of the constitution of the United States

anti-gallican.definition: Opposed to what is Gallic or French

anti-semitism.definition: Opposition to, or hatred of, Semites, esp. Jews.  The word is sometimes also applied to acts motivated by or evincing antisemitism

anti-trade.definition: A westerly wind which blows nearly continuously between 30° and 50° of latitude in both the northern and the southern hemisphere

antiacid.definition: A remedy for neutralizing acidity, especially of the stomach, as an alkali or absorbent

antiae.definition: The two projecting feathered angles of the forehead of some birds; the frontal points

antialbumid.definition: A body formed from albumin by pancreatic and gastric digestion. It is convertible into antipeptone

antiar.definition: A Virulent poison prepared in Java from the gum resin of one species of the upas tree (Antiaris toxicaria)

antiarin.definition: A poisonous principle obtained from antiar

antiattrition.definition: Anything to prevent the effects of friction, esp. a compound lubricant for machinery, etc., often consisting of plumbago, with some greasy material; antifriction grease

antibacchius.definition: A foot of three syllables, the first two long, and the last short (#)

antibacterial.definition: killing or inhibiting the growth of bacteria; -- applied also to serum for protection against bacterial diseases

antibaryon.definition: the antiparticle of a baryon; a hadron with a baryon number of -1

antibillous.definition: Counteractive of bilious complaints; tending to relieve biliousness

antibiotic.definition: A chemical substance derived from a mold or bacterium that kills microorganisms and cures infections

antiblack.definition: discriminatory against black people; opposed to black people

antibody.definition: Any of various bodies or substances in the blood which act in antagonism to harmful foreign bodies, as toxins or the bacteria producing the toxins. Normal blood serum apparently contains various antibodies, and the introduction of toxins or of foreign cells also stimulates production of their specific antibodies by the immune system

antibrachial.definition: Of or pertaining to the antibrachium, or forearm

antibrachium.definition: That part of the fore limb between the brachium and the carpus; the forearm

antibromic.definition: An agent that destroys offensive smells; a deodorizer

antibubonic.definition: Good or used against bubonic plague; as, antibubonic serum, obtained from immunized horses; antibubonic vaccine, a sterilized bouillon culture of the plague bacillus; antibubonic measures

antiburgher.definition: One who seceded from the Scottish Burghers (1747), deeming it improper to take the Burgess oath

anticathode.definition: The part of a vacuum tube opposite the cathode. Upon it the cathode rays impinge

antichlor.definition: Any substance (but especially sodium hyposulphite) used in removing the excess of chlorine left in paper pulp or stuffs after bleaching

antichrist.definition: A denier or opponent of Christ. Specif.: A great antagonist, person or power, expected to precede Christ's second coming

antichristianism.definition: Opposition or contrariety to the Christian religion

antichronical.definition: Deviating from the proper order of time

antichronism.definition: Deviation from the true order of time; anachronism

antichthon.definition: A hypothetical earth counter to ours, or on the opposite side of the sun

anticipate.definition: To be before in doing; to do or take before another; to preclude or prevent by prior action

anticipated.definition: expected; opposite of unanticipated and unexpected

anticipation.definition: The act of anticipating, taking up, placing, or considering something beforehand, or before the proper time in natural order

anticipatory.definition: Forecasting; of the nature of anticipation

anticivism.definition: Opposition to the body politic of citizens

anticlastic.definition: Having opposite curvatures, that is, curved longitudinally in one direction and transversely in the opposite direction, as the surface of a saddle

anticlimax.definition: A sentence in which the ideas fall, or become less important and striking, at the close; -- the opposite of climax. It produces a ridiculous effect

anticlinal.definition: Inclining or dipping in opposite directions. See Synclinal

anticline.definition: A structure of bedded rocks in which the beds on both sides of an axis or axial plane dip away from the axis; an anticlinal.  Contrassted with syncline

anticlinorium.definition: The upward elevation of the crust of the earth, resulting from a geanticlinal

anticoherer.definition: A device, one form of which consists of a scratched deposit of silver on glass, used in connection with the receiving apparatus for reading wireless signals. The electric waves falling on this contrivance increase its resistance several times. The anticoherer can be used in conjunction with a telephone

anticor.definition: A dangerous inflammatory swelling of a horse's breast, just opposite the heart

anticous.definition: Facing toward the axis of the flower, as in the introrse anthers of the water lily

anticyclone.definition: A movement of the atmosphere opposite in character, as regards direction of the wind and distribution of barometric pressure, to that of a cyclone

anticyclonic.definition: of or pertaining to an anticyclone; moving in the opposite direction of a cyclone

antidiphtheritic.definition: Destructive to, or hindering the growth of, diphtheria bacilli

antidisestablishmentarianism.definition: the doctrine or political position that opposes the withdrawal of state recognition of an established church; -- used especially concerning the Anglican Church in England.  Opposed to disestablishmentarianism

antidorcas.definition: A genus of mammals comprising the springbucks (or springboks).  The main species is Antidorcas marsupialis the springbuck, of which there are three subspecies: the cape springbuck (marsupialis), the Kalahari springbuck (hofmeyri) and the Angolan springbuck (angolensis)

antidotal.definition: Having the quality an antidote; fitted to counteract the effects of poison

antidote.definition: A remedy to counteract the effects of poison, or of anything noxious taken into the stomach; -- used with against, for, or to; as, an antidote against, for, or to, poison

antidromous.definition: Changing the direction in the spiral sequence of leaves on a stem

antigalastic.definition: Causing a diminution or a suppression of the secretion of milk

antiguggler.definition: A crooked tube of metal, to be introduced into the neck of a bottle for drawing out the liquid without disturbing the sediment or causing a gurgling noise

antihelix.definition: The curved elevation of the cartilage of the ear, within or in front of the helix. See Ear

antilegomena.definition: Certain books of the New Testament which were for a time not universally received, but which are now considered canonical. These are the Epistle to the Hebrews, the Epistles of James and Jude, the second Epistle of Peter, the second and third Epistles of John, and the Revelation. The undisputed books are called the Homologoumena

antilithic.definition: Tending to prevent the formation of urinary calculi, or to destroy them when formed

antilogarithm.definition: The number corresponding to a logarithm. The word has been sometimes, though rarely, used to denote the complement of a given logarithm; also the logarithmic cosine corresponding to a given logarithmic sine

antilogous.definition: Of the contrary name or character; -- opposed to analogous

antilogy.definition: A contradiction between any words or passages in an author

antilopine.definition: Of or relating to the antelope

antimacassar.definition: A cover for the back or arms of a chair or sofa, etc., to prevent them from wear or from being soiled by macassar or other oil from the hair

antimagistrical.definition: Opposed to the office or authority of magistrates

antimask.definition: A secondary mask, or grotesque interlude, between the parts of a serious mask

antimatter.definition: Matter whch is composed of antiparticles such as antiprotons, positrons, and antineutrons

antimephitic.definition: Good against mephitic or deleterious gases

antimere.definition: One of the two halves of bilaterally symmetrical animals; one of any opposite symmetrical or homotypic parts in animals and plants

antimetabole.definition: A figure in which the same words or ideas are repeated in transposed order

antimetathesis.definition: An antithesis in which the members are repeated in inverse order

antimeter.definition: A modification of the quadrant, for measuring small angles

antimonate.definition: A compound of antimonic acid with a base or basic radical

antimoniated.definition: Combined or prepared with antimony; as, antimoniated tartar

antimonic.definition: Pertaining to, or derived from, antimony; -- said of those compounds of antimony in which this element has its highest equivalence; as, antimonic acid

antimonious.definition: Pertaining to, or derived from, antimony; -- said of those compounds of antimony in which this element has an equivalence next lower than the highest; as, antimonious acid

antimonite.definition: A compound of antimonious acid and a base or basic radical

antimoniureted.definition: Combined with or containing antimony; as, antimoniureted hydrogen

antimonsoon.definition: The upper, contrary-moving current of the atmosphere over a monsoon

antimony.definition: An elementary substance, resembling a metal in its appearance and physical properties, but in its chemical relations belonging to the class of nonmetallic substances. Atomic weight, 120. Symbol, Sb

antimycin.definition: one of several antibiotic substances produced by several species of Streptomyces, active against various fungi. They are used only experimentally, not in medicine. The two best-known antimycins are antimycin A1 (C28H40N2O9) and antimycin A3 (C26H36N2O9).  They are notable for their mechanism of action, interference with the proton pumping mechanism of fungi

antinational.definition: Antagonistic to one's country or nation, or to a national government

antinephritic.definition: Counteracting, or deemed of use in, diseases of the kidneys

antineutrino.definition: The antiparticle of a neutrino.  Each type of neutrino has a corresponding antineutrino

antineutron.definition: The antiparticle of a neutron. It has the same mass as a neutron, but a spin and magnetic moment opposite that of the neutron

antinomian.definition: Of or pertaining to the Antinomians; opposed to the doctrine that the moral law is obligatory

antinomianism.definition: The tenets or practice of Antinomians

antinomy.definition: Opposition of one law or rule to another law or rule

antiochian.definition: Pertaining to Antiochus, a contemporary with Cicero, and the founder of a sect of philosophers

antiorgastic.definition: Tending to allay venereal excitement or desire; sedative

antipapal.definition: Opposed to the pope or to popery

antiparallels.definition: Straight lines or planes which make angles in some respect opposite in character to those made by parallel lines or planes

antiparticle.definition: A fundamental particle which has the same mass as one of the common fundamental particles, but which has an opposite charge, and for which certain other of the properties (e. g. baryon number, strangeness) may be opposite to that of the normal particle.  The antiparticle to an electron is called a positron; the antiparticle to a proton is called an antiproton; the antiparticle to a neutron is called an antineutron.  When a particle and its corresponding antiparticle collide, they typically annihilate each other with the production of large quantities of energy, usually in the form of radiation.  The interaction of a proton and antiproton cause annihilation with production of mesons

antipasch.definition: The Sunday after Easter; Low Sunday

antipathetic.definition: Having a natural contrariety, or constitutional aversion, to a thing; characterized by antipathy; -- often followed by to

antipathic.definition: Belonging to antipathy; opposite; contrary; allopathic

antipathous.definition: Having a natural contrariety; adverse; antipathetic

antipathy.definition: Contrariety or opposition in feeling; settled aversion or dislike; repugnance; distaste

antipeptone.definition: A product of gastric and pancreatic digestion, differing from hemipeptone in not being decomposed by the continued action of pancreatic juice

antiperiodic.definition: A remedy possessing the property of preventing the return of periodic paroxysms, or exacerbations, of disease, as in intermittent fevers

antiperistaltic.definition: Opposed to, or checking motion; acting upward; -- applied to an inverted action of the intestinal tube

antiperistasis.definition: Opposition by which the quality opposed acquires strength; resistance or reaction roused by opposition or by the action of an opposite principle or quality

antipetalous.definition: Standing before a petal, as a stamen

antiphlogistian.definition: An opposer of the theory of phlogiston

antiphlogistic.definition: Opposed to the doctrine of phlogiston

antiphon.definition: A musical response; alternate singing or chanting. See Antiphony, and Antiphone

antiphonal.definition: Of or pertaining to antiphony, or alternate singing; sung alternately by a divided choir or opposite choirs

antiphonary.definition: A book containing a collection of antiphons; the book in which the antiphons of the breviary, with their musical notes, are contained

antiphone.definition: The response which one side of the choir makes to the other in a chant; alternate chanting or signing

antiphony.definition: A musical response; also, antiphonal chanting or signing

antiphrasis.definition: The use of words in a sense opposite to their proper meaning; as when a court of justice is called a court of vengeance

antiphthisic.definition: Relieving or curing phthisis, or consumption

antipodal.definition: Pertaining to the antipodes; situated on the opposite side of the globe

antipode.definition: One of the antipodes; anything exactly opposite

antipodean.definition: Pertaining to the antipodes, or the opposite side of the world; antipodal

antipodes.definition: Those who live on the side of the globe diametrically opposite

antipole.definition: The opposite pole; anything diametrically opposed

antipope.definition: One who is elected, or claims to be, pope in opposition to the pope canonically chosen; esp. applied to those popes who resided at Avignon during the Great Schism

antipsoric.definition: Of use in curing the itch

antiptosis.definition: The putting of one case for another

antiputrefactive.definition: Counteracting, or preserving from, putrefaction; antiseptic

antipyresis.definition: The condition or state of being free from fever

antipyretic.definition: Efficacious in preventing or allaying fever

antipyrine.definition: An artificial alkaloid, believed to be efficient in abating fever

antiquarian.definition: Pertaining to antiquaries, or to antiquity; as, antiquarian literature

antiquarianism.definition: Character of an antiquary; study or love of antiquities

antiquarianize.definition: To act the part of an antiquary

antiquate.definition: To make old, or obsolete; to make antique; to make old in such a degree as to put out of use; hence, to make void, or abrogate

antiquated.definition: Grown old. Hence: Bygone; obsolete; out of use; old-fashioned; as, an antiquated law

antiquation.definition: The act of making antiquated, or the state of being antiquated

antique.definition: Old; ancient; of genuine antiquity; as, an antique statue. In this sense it usually refers to the flourishing ages of Greece and Rome

antiqueness.definition: The quality of being antique; an appearance of ancient origin and workmanship

antiquist.definition: An antiquary; a collector of antiques

antiquitarian.definition: An admirer of antiquity. [Used by Milton in a disparaging sense.]

antiquity.definition: The quality of being ancient; ancientness; great age; as, a statue of remarkable antiquity; a family of great antiquity

antirenter.definition: One opposed to the payment of rent; esp. one of those who in 1840-47 resisted the collection of rents claimed by the patroons from the settlers on certain manorial lands in the State of New York

antisabbatarian.definition: One of a sect which opposes the observance of the Christian Sabbath

antisacerdotal.definition: Hostile to priests or the priesthood

antiscians.definition: The inhabitants of the earth, living on different sides of the equator, whose shadows at noon are cast in opposite directions

antiscriptural.definition: Opposed to, or not in accordance with, the Holy Scriptures

antisepalous.definition: Standing before a sepal, or calyx leaf

antisepsis.definition: Prevention of sepsis by excluding or destroying microorganisms

antiseptic.definition: Counteracting or preventing putrefaction, or a putrescent tendency in the system; antiputrefactive

antisocial.definition: Tending to interrupt or destroy social intercourse; averse to society, or hostile to its existence; as, antisocial principles

antisocialist.definition: One opposed to the doctrines and practices of socialists or socialism

antisolar.definition: Opposite to the sun; -- said of the point in the heavens 180° distant from the sun

antispast.definition: A foot of four syllables, the first and fourth short, and the second and third long (#)

antispastic.definition: Believed to cause a revulsion of fluids or of humors from one part to another

antisplenetic.definition: Good as a remedy against disease of the spleen

antistrophe.definition: In Greek choruses and dances, the returning of the chorus, exactly answering to a previous strophe or movement from right to left. Hence: The lines of this part of the choral song

antistrophic.definition: Of or pertaining to an antistrophe

antistrophon.definition: An argument retorted on an opponent

antitheist.definition: A disbeliever in the existence of God

antithesis.definition: An opposition or contrast of words or sentiments occurring in the same sentence; as, “The prodigal robs his heir; the miser robs himself.”  “He had covertly shot at Cromwell; he how openly aimed at the Queen.”

antithetic.definition: Pertaining to antithesis, or opposition of words and sentiments; containing, or of the nature of, antithesis; contrasted

antitoxin.definition: A substance (sometimes the product of a specific micro-organism and sometimes naturally present in the blood or tissues of an animal), capable of producing immunity from certain diseases, or of counteracting the poisonous effects of pathogenic bacteria

antitragus.definition: A prominence on the lower posterior portion of the concha of the external ear, opposite the tragus. See Ear

antitrochanter.definition: An articular surface on the ilium of birds against which the great trochanter of the femur plays

antitropal.definition: At the extremity most remote from the hilum, as the embryo, or inverted with respect to the seed, as the radicle

antitrust.definition: opposed to trusts, monopolies, or other large combinations of business or capital which threaten fair competition; designed to protect trade and commerce from unfair business practices; -- of laws and regulations

antitussive.definition: having ability to  to suppress or relieve coughing; -- of chemical substances

antitype.definition: That of which the type is the pattern or representation; that which is represented by the type or symbol

antitypical.definition: Of or pertaining to an antitype; explaining the type

antitypy.definition: Opposition or resistance of matter to force

antivenin.definition: The serum of blood rendered antitoxic to a venom by repeated injections of small doses of the venom; also, the component of such a serum which is antitoxic to the venom

antler.definition: The entire horn, or any branch of the horn, of a cervine animal, as of a stag

antlia.definition: The spiral tubular proboscis of lepidopterous insects. See Lepidoptera

antoeci.definition: Those who live under the same meridian, but on opposite parallels of latitude, north and south of the equator

antonomasia.definition: The use of some epithet or the name of some office, dignity, or the like, instead of the proper name of the person; as when his majesty is used for a king, or when, instead of Aristotle, we say, the philosopher; or, conversely, the use of a proper name instead of an appellative, as when a wise man is called a Solomon, or an eminent orator a Cicero

antonomastic.definition: Pertaining to, or characterized by, antonomasia

antonym.definition: A word of opposite meaning; a counterterm; -- used as a correlative of synonym

antorbital.definition: Pertaining to, or situated in, the region of the front of the orbit

antozone.definition: A compound formerly supposed to be modification of oxygen, but now known to be hydrogen dioxide; -- so called because apparently antagonistic to ozone, converting it into ordinary oxygen

antrum.definition: A cavern or cavity, esp. an anatomical cavity or sinus

antrustion.definition: A vassal or voluntary follower of Frankish princes in their enterprises

anubis.definition: An Egyptian deity, the conductor of departed spirits to judgment, represented by a human figure with the head of a jackal, dog or fox

anunnaki.definition: any of a group of powerful earth spirits or genii; servitors of the gods

anura.definition: One of the orders of amphibians characterized by the absence of a tail, as the frogs and toads

anuran.definition: an amphibian of the order Anura; any of various tailless stout-bodied amphibians with long hind limbs for leaping; semiaquatic and terrestrial species; a frog or toad

anurous.definition: Destitute of a tail, as the frogs and toads

anury.definition: Nonsecretion or defective secretion of urine; ischury

anus.definition: The posterior opening of the alimentary canal, through which the excrements are expelled

anvil.definition: An iron block, usually with a steel face, upon which metals are hammered and shaped

anxietude.definition: The state of being anxious; anxiety

anxiety.definition: Concern or solicitude respecting some thing or event, future or uncertain, which disturbs the mind, and keeps it in a state of painful uneasiness

anxious.definition: Full of anxiety or disquietude; greatly concerned or solicitous, esp. respecting something future or unknown; being in painful suspense; -- applied to persons; as, anxious for the issue of a battle

anxiously.definition: In an anxious manner; with painful uncertainty; solicitously

anxiousness.definition: The quality of being anxious; great solicitude; anxiety

any.definition: One indifferently, out of an indefinite number; one indefinitely, whosoever or whatsoever it may be

anybody.definition: Any one out of an indefinite number of persons; anyone; any person

anyhow.definition: In any way or manner whatever; at any rate; in any event

anyone.definition: One taken at random rather than by selection; anybody. [Commonly written as two words.]

anything.definition: Any object, act, state, event, or fact whatever; thing of any kind; something or other; aught; as, I would not do it for anything

anythingarian.definition: One who holds to no particular creed or dogma

anywise.definition: In any wise or way; at all

aonian.definition: Pertaining to Aonia, in Bœotia, or to the Muses, who were supposed to dwell there

aorist.definition: A tense in the Greek language, which expresses an action as completed in past time, but leaves it, in other respects, wholly indeterminate

aoristic.definition: Indefinite; pertaining to the aorist tense

aorta.definition: The great artery which carries the blood from the heart to all parts of the body except the lungs; the main trunk of the arterial system

aortal.definition: of or pertaining to the aorta

aortic.definition: Of or pertaining to the aorta

aotus.definition: a genus of nocturnal South American monkeys with large eyes; the owl monkeys; the douroucoulis.  See douroucouli

aoudad.definition: An African sheeplike quadruped (the Ammotragus lervia, formerly Ammotragus tragelaphus) having a long mane on the breast and fore legs; the wild sheep of northern Africa; -- called also Barbary sheep. It is, perhaps, the chamois of the Old Testament

apace.definition: With a quick pace; quick; fast; speedily

apaches.definition: A group of nomadic North American Indians including several tribes native of Arizona, New Mexico, etc

apagoge.definition: An indirect argument which proves a thing by showing the impossibility or absurdity of the contrary

apagogic.definition: Proving indirectly, by showing the absurdity, or impossibility of the contrary

apair.definition: To impair or become impaired; to injure

apanthropy.definition: An aversion to the company of men; a love of solitude

aparejo.definition: A kind of pack saddle used in the American military service and among the Spanish Americans. It is made of leather stuffed with hay, moss, or the like

apart.definition: Separately, in regard to space or company; in a state of separation as to place; aside

apartheid.definition: segregation by race; -- a term used in South Africa

apartment.definition: A room in a building; a division in a house, separated from others by partitions

apartment house.definition: A building comprising a number of lving units (apartments{4}) designed for separate housekeeping tenements, but having conveniences, such as heat, light, elevator service, etc., furnished in common; contrasted to a detached dwelling.  Sometimes distinguished in the United States from a flat house, in which each living unit comprises one entire floor, whereas in an apartment house a floor may be partitioned into any number of apartments{4}

apastron.definition: That point in the orbit of a double star where the smaller star is farthest from its primary

apathetic.definition: Void of feeling; not susceptible of deep emotion; passionless

apathist.definition: One who is destitute of feeling

apathy.definition: Want of feeling; privation of passion, emotion, or excitement; dispassion; -- applied either to the body or the mind. As applied to the mind, it is a calmness, indolence, or state of indifference, incapable of being ruffled or roused to active interest or exertion by pleasure, pain, or passion

apatite.definition: Native phosphate of lime, occurring usually in six-sided prisms, color often pale green, transparent or translucent

apatosaurus.definition: a genus of extinct dinosaurs comprising the brontosaurs; apatosaurs

apatura.definition: a genus of large Old World butterflies

ape.definition: A quadrumanous mammal, esp. of the family Simiadæ, having teeth of the same number and form as in man, and possessing neither a tail nor cheek pouches. The name is applied esp. to species of the genus Hylobates, and is sometimes used as a general term for all Quadrumana. The higher forms, the gorilla, chimpanzee, and ourang, are often called anthropoid apes or man apes

apeak.definition: In a vertical line. The anchor in apeak, when the cable has been sufficiently hove in to bring the ship over it, and the ship is them said to be hove apeak

apehood.definition: The state of being an ape

apennine.definition: Of, pertaining to, or designating, the Apennines, a chain of mountains extending through Italy

apercu.definition: A first view or glance, or the perception or estimation so obtained; an immediate apprehension or insight, appreciative rather than analytic

aperea.definition: The wild Guinea pig of Brazil (Cavia aperea)

apertion.definition: The act of opening; an opening; an aperture

apery.definition: A place where apes are kept

apetalous.definition: Having no petals, or flower leaves. [See Illust. under Anther]

apex.definition: The tip, top, point, or angular summit of anything; as, the apex of a mountain, spire, or cone; the apex, or tip, of a leaf

aphaeretic.definition: relating to or formed by or consisting of aphaeresis

aphakia.definition: An anomalous state of refraction caused by the absence of the crystalline lens, as after operations for cataract. The remedy is the use of powerful convex lenses

aphakial.definition: Pertaining to aphakia; as, aphakial eyes

aphaniptera.definition: A group of wingless insects, of which the flea in the type. See Flea

aphanipterous.definition: Of or pertaining to the Aphaniptera

aphanite.definition: A very compact, dark-colored &unr_;ock, consisting of hornblende, or pyroxene, and feldspar, but neither of them in perceptible grains

aphanitic.definition: Resembling aphanite; having a very fine-grained structure

aphasia.definition: Loss of the power of speech, or of the appropriate use of words, the vocal organs remaining intact, and the intelligence being preserved. It is dependent on injury or disease of the brain

aphasic.definition: Pertaining to, or affected by, aphasia; speechless

aphasmidia.definition: one of two subgroups of Nematoda used in some classification systems

aphelion.definition: That point of a planet's or comet's orbit which is most distant from the sun, the opposite point being the perihelion

apheliotropic.definition: Turning away from the sun; -- said of leaves, etc

apheliotropism.definition: The habit of bending from the sunlight; -- said of certain plants

aphemia.definition: Loss of the power of speaking, while retaining the power of writing; -- a disorder of cerebral origin

apheresis.definition: The dropping of a letter or syllable from the beginning of a word; e. g., cute for acute

aphesis.definition: The loss of a short unaccented vowel at the beginning of a word; -- the result of a phonetic process; as, squire for esquire

aphetic.definition: Shortened by dropping a letter or a syllable from the beginning of a word; as, an aphetic word or form

aphetism.definition: An aphetized form of a word

aphid.definition: One of the genus Aphis; an aphidian

aphidian.definition: Of or pertaining to the family Aphidæ

aphidophagous.definition: Feeding upon aphides, or plant lice, as do beetles of the family Coccinellidæ

aphilanthropy.definition: Want of love to mankind; -- the opposite of philanthropy

aphis.definition: A genus of insects belonging to the order Hemiptera and family Aphidæ, including numerous species known as plant lice and green flies

aphis lion.definition: The larva of the lacewinged flies (Chrysopa), which feeds voraciously upon aphids. The name is also applied to the larvæ of the ladybugs (Coccinella)

aphlogistic.definition: Flameless; as, an aphlogistic lamp, in which a coil of wire is kept in a state of continued ignition by alcohol, without flame

aphonia.definition: Loss of voice or vocal utterance

aphonic.definition: Without voice; voiceless; nonvocal; incapable of all but whispered speech

aphorism.definition: A comprehensive maxim or principle expressed in a few words; a sharply defined sentence relating to abstract truth rather than to practical matters

aphorismatic.definition: Pertaining to aphorisms, or having the form of an aphorism

aphorist.definition: A writer or utterer of aphorisms

aphoristic.definition: In the form of, or of the nature of, an aphorism; in the form of short, unconnected sentences; as, an aphoristic style

aphoristically.definition: In the form or manner of aphorisms; pithily

aphotic region.definition: A depth of water so great that only those organisms can exist that do not assimilate

aphrodisiac.definition: Exciting venereal desire; stimulating the desire for sexual gratification

aphrodisian.definition: Pertaining to Aphrodite or Venus. “Aphrodisian dames” [that is, courtesans]

aphrodite.definition: The Greek goddess of love, corresponding to the Venus of the Romans

aphtha.definition: One of the whitish specks called aphthæ

aphthae.definition: Roundish pearl-colored specks or flakes in the mouth, on the lips, etc., terminating in white sloughs. They are commonly characteristic of thrush

aphthoid.definition: Of the nature of aphthæ; resembling thrush
